loans.name: Mercedes Alina

texts.es: La Sra. Alina tiene 47 años y vive en la comunidad de Guerra del Departamento. de Tarija,   la Sra. Alina es casada; tiene y vive en casa propia junto a su hijo, por lo que su esposo viaja a otro pais a trabajar por lo que no participa en el presente crédito, tiene principalmente la producción de productos agrícolas, esta producción la realiza en terrenos propios de herencia de su padre cuenta con herramientas y terrenos necesarios para esta actividad, al Sra., Alina nos indica que con el crédito que sacara lo usara para la compra de semilla de papa como también para compra de abono orgánico para la producción de papa que sacara el mes de octubre, según la experiencia que tiene en este negocio nos indica que sus ventas se irán incrementando a medida que se vayan mejorando el proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Alina is 47 years old and lives in the Guerra del Departamento community of Tarija. Alina is married and lives in her own house with her son. Her husband traveled to another country for work and as such, is not participating in the current loan. She primarily works in the production of agricultural products. She does this work on her own land inherited from her father. She has her own tools and land necessary for this work. 

Alina has said that with the loan that she is taking out she will buy potato seeds as well as organic fertilizer for the potato production which will take up the month of October. According to the experience she has in this work, she says that her sales will continue increasing at a measure that will improve the production process.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Vividjegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVIDJEGBE est composé de vingt quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Houéfa Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houéfa Véronique est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Léopold. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Houéfa Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Houéfa Véronique assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Houéfa Véronique vend du maïs et de la bouillie de maïs à son domicile et dans un marché. De façon secondaire, Houéfa Véronique vend de la farine de maïs. Houéfa Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Houéfa Véronique ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VIVIDJEGBE, sollicitent un premier credit  auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a 41 year old woman who is very dynamic and has been selling for 19 years. She is married and has three children and a husband who help her with her business. She sells sausage and yogurt and has been well accepted by her clients. She started her business four years ago in the local market in order to be self-sufficient and support her family's economy and, over time, she has increased her business.

Teresa is asking a loan of $ 650 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase her inventory and offer better services to her clients. She intends to pay back the loan over a term of 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

La Señora Teresa es una mujer de 41 años muy activa que se dedica al comercio desde hace 19 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que ayudan en el negocio al igual que su esposo. Su negocio es la venta de embutidos y yogur, los cuales tienen una muy buena aceptación entre sus clientes. Desde hace cuatro años inicio su negocio en el tianguis ante la necesidad de generar ingresos y poder ayudar a la economía familiar y durante este tiempo ha hecho crecer el negocio.

Teresa requiere un crédito por $ 650 USD para comprar mercancías y poder incrementar sus inventarios y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zanfira

texts.en: Zanfira is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city,  and has 2 children. This 51-year-old woman has been engaged in a carpet factory for 18 years. Zanfira used to work at a weaving factory but decided that she wanted to start her own business. She supports her family with this business. Now Zanfira needs a loan amount of $1200 to buy the carpet machine.

loans.use: To buy the carpet machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy animal Feeds for Her Dairy Cows and 300 chickens.

loans.name: Egwuogu

texts.en: Miss A. Eqwuogu is 34 years old. She has a little store where she sells handbags and shoes and and does her clients' nails. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria and is an experienced person in her business. She needs a loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for her inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 39-year-old mother of four and a resident of Mbagala area, Dar Es Salaam’s largest slum area. She owns a boutique that specializes in ladies items (shoes, clothing, and hand bags). She has been in business for the past five years, and her business has been growing steadily since joining the Youth Self Employment foundation. She trades in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s biggest trading areas, and her business booms during the Easter and Christmas seasons. She is requesting a loan of $550 to increase her stock so she can take more advantage of her boom periods and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Santiago Florencio

texts.es:
Santiago is a selfless father, and as a good head of household, he has in mind what he should do to support his family. He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock five years ago, after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He added everything he learned to the education his parents instilled in him since he was a child. He stopped practicing his professional career of nursing because the low wages that he received didn't let him support his three sons. Now he is dedicated to raising and fattening his cattle. He rents and sells the breed that he raises at his farm for bullfighting activities in the various towns in the Mantaro Valley. In accordance with upcoming celebrations, Santiago presently has 12 cattle that he is raising for these activities. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. Subsequently, he plans to open a small pharmacy in the city where he can practice his profession independently. This is why he is requesting a loan of $100 that would allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago es un padre abnegado y como buen jefe de familia tiene en cuenta que debe sostener su hogar. Decidió dedicarse a la ganadería hace 5 años, después de adquirir experiencia trabajando un tiempo en una hacienda ganadera y adicionó tofo lo aprendido a la enseñanza que sus padres le inculcaron desde niño, dejando así de ejercer su carrera profesional de enfermería por el bajo sueldo que percibía y el cual no le alcanzaba para sostener a sus 3 hijosAhora se dedica a criar y a engordar su ganado, la raza que cobija en casa le permite poder arrendar y vender su ganado para las corridas de toros y otras actividades taurinas en los diferentes pueblos del valle del Mantaro; deacuerdo a sus fechas festivas, en la actualidad cuenta con 12 vacunos que le permiten poder realizar estas actividades; Santiago piensa seguir dedicándose a la ganadería y por ello piensa adquirir más ganado y posteriormente abrir una botica en el centro de la ciudad para ejercer independientemente su profesión. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares que le permitirán poder comprar más alimentos para su normal desarrollo y competitividad, desde ahora agradece a aquellas personas que gentilmente accedan a su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase of food for cattle

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana rents a shop near the entrance to her town where she sells all sorts of groceries. At this hot time of year, when the sun beats down on the Peruvian jungle, cold soft drinks are very popular and she always makes a point of stocking them. Unfortunately, the monthly rent on the shop is very high and this eats into Yovana's profits. She is asking for a loan to finish building the home and shop she has begun so she can move her business there and see better returns for her labor. Let's help her benefit from her own hard work.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yovana, nos contó que por esta época de inmensa irradiación del astro sol, en la selva peruana, empiezan a tener un incremento de temperatura en su comunidad y este fenómeno es muy notorio; razón por la que las bebidas frías son muy solicitadas por los visitantes y lugareños, es por este hecho que en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la entrada de su comunidad se dedica además de ofrecer sus artículos ya acostumbrados a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos que gracias al gran calor existente tiene muy alta demanda y el lugar es muy concurrido.Sin embargo tiene un enorme problema debido a que este puesto es alquilado, por lo que tiene que pagar considerables sumas de dinero mensualmente, lo que sin duda merma grandemente los ingresos que con mucho esfuerzo obtiene. Ella solicita una suma de dinero en préstamo para terminar de construir su casita para que allí pueda trasladar su negocio con el objetivo de dejar de pagar el arriendo elevado que le imponen y obtener mejores beneficios económicos para su hogar. Apoyémosla a que siga prosperando con su digna labor.

loans.use: To stock a grocery store with soft drinks and eventually to construct a new shop.

loans.name: Ana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Ana de los Angeles G. Garcia is married and has five children. She studied up to 5th grade. She has a business selling food in the county market of Chichigalpa. She started the business when her husband's income was very low. She had always enjoyed preparing food, and had been selling food at her home every afternoon. Ten years ago, at the insistence of a friend who also has a food stand at the market, she rented an unoccupied locale in the market too.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now, and she tells us that she feels very good about all the loans she has gotten because they have arrived at a good time and have been given quickly and allowed her to get ahead because through the income generated by this business they have been able to improve the living conditions in their home and have managed to ensure their children are educated.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ana de los Ángeles G. G., es casada y con cinco hijos, cursó hasta el quinto grado de primaria, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, el negocio lo comienza cuando los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran bastantes bajos, a ella siempre le gustó el negocio de comidería ya que en su casa se vendía todas las tardes, este negocio lo emprende hace diez años, esto lo logra a través de una amiga que también tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado, fue ella quien la impulso a rentar el local que estaba vacío.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que le han servido para salir a delante, ya que a través de los ingresos que les ha generado este negocio han podido mejorar sus condiciones de su hogar y a podido lograr que sus hijos se vayan preparando.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice crops from the growers to resell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a hard-working mother of four. She runs a small grocery store out of her house where she sells general necessities. Her husband is a potter who makes various decorative goods out of clay.

For seven years now she has run her grocery store and it has continued to increase in business and income. Graciela’s next goal is to save enough money from her work, along with her husband’s work, to construct a second story on their house.

She is asking for a loan today to help her flourishing business. Her plan is to buy rice, sugar, flour, general drinks and baked goods for her shop. With the increase in goods she will be better able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, baked goods and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro T. is a mother to three children and makes a living teaching in a small school in the municipality of Villanueva where she lives.
The problem currently facing this humble lady is that she needs to invest in the infrastructure of her home and for this she is seeking help from Ceprodel.  She is requesting to be beneficiary of al loan that will allow her to buy the materials for the construction.
In spite of the difficult financial situation that she has been in for some time, she always tries to give her children the best possible living conditions. Her dream is to see her children turn into successful professionals.
Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.
María del Socorro T. es madre de tres hijos el cual se dedica a la labor de la docencia en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Villanueva donde es originaria.
La problemática que hoy en día atraviesa esta humilde dama es que necesita invertir en su infraestructura de su hogar y para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan la compra de materiales para la construcción.
A pesar de la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado desde hace mucho tiempo siempre se sigue esforzando para proporcionar a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida y así poder ver realizado su sueño de que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales y de mucho éxito.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Esterfila

texts.es:
Señora Esterfilia C. G. belongs to the communal bank called 'Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin, Moyobamba. Her food stand is located in Jr. Serafin at the local supermarket called 'Erick'. She sells vegetables from the region which are purchase daily by the people in the city.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to open up her own business which took a lot of effort, but she did it anyways to support her children and to offer them a better future. Due to her good customer service, her clientele has grown.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase different types of vegetables in big quantities such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, potatotoes, sweet potatoes and yuca so that she can have enough to satisfy her clients' demands.

Señora Esterfilia is 58 years old. She's a hard-worker since she works every day non-stop. She accomplishes each goal she has set for herself without any limitations. She's dedicated to what she does and hopes that in the near future she can have her own store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esterfilia C. G. ,pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyabamba, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Serafín en un puesto del mercado “Erick”, se dedica a la venta de verduras de la región y de la costa, que diariamente es comprado por los moradores de la ciudad. Al separarse de su esposo ,decidió iniciar este tipo de negocio con mucho esfuerzo y seguir adelante para el sustento de sus hijos gracias a su buen trato supo ganarse su clientela . Con el crédito de S/.2,500.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas verduras como: camote, repollo, tomates, cebolla, papa , yucas en sacos, para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes. La señora Esterfilia tiene 58 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes, en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Rukia M.. She is married and has three children ages 1, 6, and 12. In 1995, Rukia established a business selling grains. She requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk, and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Marlene Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita (short for Guadalupe), as her customers and friends call her, lives in the city of La Libertad, El Salvador, along with her life partner and their two children.

For the past several years she has dedicated herself to the business of selling bedding (covers and cases for pillows), and her partner has been working as a brick layer.

Through their hard work and the loans they have received from Kiva's field partner Apoyo Integral, both partners have been able to acquire a greater variety of merchandise, meet the demands of their clients, and increase sales. This has helped them generate enough income to maintain their family. Now they would like to begin improving their home through the construction of a perimeter wall that will bring greater security to the whole family. For this reason Lupita is asking for a loan that will help her complete this construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lupita como le dicen sus clientes y amigos, vive en el Departamento de La Libertad, junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos que han procreado. Desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa para camas(Cobertores y forros para almohadas) y el compañero de vida se ha dedicado a realizar labores de albañilería A través del trabajo de ambos y los créditos que durante 3 años le ha brindado Apoyo Integral a podido ir adquiriendo más variedad de mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar las ventas, que le han generado la manutención de sus hijos. Ahora quiere empezar a mejorar la vivienda, con la construcción de un muro perimetral , que le brinde seguridad a toda su familia. Por ello esta solicitando un préstamo que le permita realizar dicha construcción.

loans.use: Construction of a perimeter wall

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima E. is 54 years old, married and has four adult children. She is well known as an energetic woman, and started her business 21 years ago when good jobs were not available and she wanted to make sure that her family had enough money. Karima works in the local market, selling fruits such as watermelons and melons. Her stand is popular because it has attractive prices. Her success allows Karima to generate considerable income for her family.

Karima is planning to buy more fresh fruit to fulfill the needs of a growing number of customers. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan of $950 for nine months. Karina has a positive credit history with IMON, and promises to repay this loan as promptly as she has all previous ones. The well-being of her family depends on getting this loan, and Karima wants to thank you for contributing to the growth of her business and the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi M. is a 23-year-old farmer who grows rice, while her husband is a fisherman. Yi is married but has no children. She and her husband live in Kompong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province. To expand her husband's business and increase the family's income, Yi is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase fishing tools, including nets and fishing line. This will increase their income to be able to live sufficiently. Mrs. Yi and his wife are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools including nets and fishing line

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk Y. is 35 years old and has been selling paste-fish (Khmer Cheese) and dried fish in the market since 2005. She earns about US $5.00 per day. Thouk lives with her husband and four children in Chomkar Somrong Commune, Battambang Province. Her husband, 34, sells sugarcane juice and also operates a motorcycle taxi service.

To increase her family's income, Thouk is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more paste-fish and dried fish from a wholesale supplier to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale fish products to sell in the market.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat I. is a 39-year-old farmer who also sells grocery items from her house. On average, she can earn approximately US$2.50 per day. Socheat is married to Mr. KI. Sokha and they have three children, all of whom are in school: one child is in secondary school and another child is in primary school. Her husband is a silversmith in his area and can earn approximately US$2.50 per day.

To both meet her customer's demands and to generate greater income, Socheat is seeking a loan in the amount of US$800 to expand her grocery inventory by purchasing a wider variety of products to sell. Notably, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase silver for her husband's business.

loans.use: To diversify her product offerings by purchasing additional grocery items and to purchase silver for her husband's business

loans.name: Kllong

texts.en: Kllong D., 56, has a business selling porridge and Khmer cake from her house to earn a living, and is able to make US$4 a day. She is a widow and has five of her seven children. Four children are employed as workers. Kllong D. is asking a loan of US$500 to set up a small tailoring shop for one of her daughters.

loans.use: To set up a tailor shop.

loans.name: Khajik

texts.en: Khajik is a 43-year-old man living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. He has owned a car accessories shop since 1988. Khajik has a new innovative product that he wants to introduce to the market. He is asking for $1,200 in order to finance the purchase of this new product.

loans.use: Purchase new products for automotive shop

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Расулова Зиеда жительница района Шахринау.Не замужем. Живет со свим сыном. Возраст 50 лет. Имеет столовую на центральном рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в помещении. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев  от получаемой прибыли.
texts.en:
Ziyoda R. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is not married and lives with her son. She is 50 years old. She owns an eater on the central market. She has ten years experience in this business. She plans to received a loan to make repairs in the premises. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months from the income from her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do repairs

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
EL microempresario Bismarck Antonio M. tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con 4 hijos todos estudian niveles primario y secundario respectivamente. El señor M. se dedica hace más de 20 años a la profesión de barbero y a la vez aprovecha su local para vender refrescos.

Este microempresario tiene muchos clientes quienes lo visitan ya que cuenta con una variedad de cortes de pelos tanto estilos de moda como otros que son preferidos por personas adultas.

Actualmente el señor  M. tiene 2 sillas de barbero por lo que contrata a otra persona para que también realice esta actividad, sin embargo tiene una buena demanda de clientes por lo que requiere aumentar su inventario comprando otra silla, espejos y televisor que le permita dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, esto con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y  poder pagar el alquiler del local.

Por tal razón solicita se le financie lo siguiente:


1 silla de barbero la cual tiene un valor de US$ 500 dólares, 2 espejos grandes  que les cuesta US$ 100 dólares cada uno y 1 televisor a colores que le cuesta US$ 300 dólares.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Bismarck Antonia M. is 42 years old and is married with 4 children, all of whom are in primary or secondary school. Mr. M. has been a barber for more than 20 years and is now taking advantage of his store to sell refreshments. This micro-entrepreneur has many clients who visit him because they know that he can give them a variety of haircuts, including fashionable styles, like those that adult men like. At present, Mr. M. has 2 chairs in his store, so he hires another person who also does this activity. However, he has many clients, so he needs to buy another chair, mirrors, and television, which will allow him to take better care of his clients. This will allow him to earn more income so that he can pay the rent for his store. As a result, he is requesting financing for the following: 1 barber’s chair for $500, 2 mirrors for $100 each, and 1 television for $300.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 barber's chair, 2 large mirrors, and a color television

loans.name: Ruhzora

texts.ru:
Гуломшоева Рухзора 23 года, не замужем. Она помогает  родителям личным вкладом в семейно-бытовые расходы. Также помощница матери по продаже посуд. Они торгуют на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе посудами: тарелки, чайники, сервисные наборы, подарочными наборами... Продаваемые  товары являются необходимыми в повседневной жизни. У них много клиентов. Сама Рухзора имеет высшее образование. Закупают они товар у поставщиков из Китая.
        Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа сервисных наборов хочет получить займ в   сумме 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Ruhzora G. is 23 years old, she is not married. She helps her parents and doing her part by taking on the household expenses. She also helps her mother to sell china. They sell china on the Korvon market in Dushanbe which include plates, teapots, whole dining sets as well as gift sets. These items are the necessities of every day life. They have many clients. Ruhzora herself has a high education. They purchase the merchandise from suppliers from China.
To increase the assortment of their inventory and commodity circulation they want to get a loan for 3500 somoni (US$950) to buy more dining sets.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dining sets

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine O. is 56 years old and is separated from her husband. She has five children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells secondhand bags to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of $675 to purchase more secondhand bags to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand bags to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica M. is 35 years old and married to Chester, a policeman assigned to Bulacan, which is approximately seven hours from their place. The couple was blessed with three children: Chesca - 4 years old; Jester - 2 years old; and the youngest Frena Mae - 1 month old. She hopes to give her children a better education in the future and raise them with good values, even though her husband works far away from them.  

Jessica operates a tricycle transport business that one of her relatives drives, and then gives her a daily boundary (like a rent for the tricycle) of PHP200.00. Jessica would like to venture into another business like selling frozen food to increase her income. Thus, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP8,000 since her income from her tricycle is just enough to meet their daily needs. She prays that her request loan will be approved so that she will be able to save money to support her children’s education in the future.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance and to start a new business

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Mame Yacine D. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de drap de lit et rideaux qu’elle confectionne elle-même. Elle souhaite améliorer cette activité pour  appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mame Yacine D., age 51, is married and the mother of seven. She is active in the commerce of bed sheets and curtains that she makes herself. She would like to improve this business to support her husband in caring for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell bed sheets and curtains

loans.name: Jean Ann

texts.en:
"Farming is not sustaining, especially when there are only provided for lesser quality seeds, fertilizers and insecticides" says Jean Ann D. C., a farmer and a mother of 2 children. " In our case, we are the ones who sow the seeds and we seldom hire people to help us run our farm. We have fewer expenses in terms of manpower. However, because we don't have enough capital to finance our business more, we hardly hit the maximum yield of our crops," she added.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds. The loan will help her have a better harvest.

CEVI is teaching farmers to grow their farms. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. lives in the village of Usocan. She is 43 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna raises livestock, primarily pigs. Myrna has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that will help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Myrna has successfully repaid three loans, and is requesting a new one to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa T. is fifty-three years old and has reared ten children. She currently lives with her husband in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of her children have grown up and live with their own families now. Dariimaa has a small retail business, selling various small food items such as chewing gum, soft-drinks, cigars, and so on.

In 2000, her family moved from Khovd, one of the most isolated western provinces in Mongolia, to the capital city in search of a better life. In 2001, she started her small retail business in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Now she is expanding her business by diversifying the products she sells at the market.

Seeing an opportunity in the underwear market, and utilizing her experience in retail, she has decided to enter this new market. Dariimaa seems to be a very responsible person in business and finance. She is requesting a loan to buy underwear to sell. With the profits from her business, she hopes to enlarge her house.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Emma is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fist loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao de

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en: Amarbayasgalan C. is a single mother who has two sons. Her family lives in a "ger" (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Her eldest son Nyamdalai, 18, has just graduated from high school and helps his mother's tailoring business. Her youngest son Byambasuren, 15, is attending school. Amarbayasgalan has been running a sewing business since 2006. She sews a variety of men’s and women’s apparel including Mongolian traditional dresses. Most of her clients are local residents. When she started her business her working capital was 150,000 tugrugs (1 USD=1450 MNT) but, as a result of her hard work, her capital has increased and reached 780,000 tugrugs. Amarbayasgalan requests a loan to purchase fabrics as a raw material to increase her business inventory. About XacBank: Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro-clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country. XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses. Your loan enables XacBank to expand its micro-loan capacity and to return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term. To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabrics for her business

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102238&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Marivel  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Marivel  tiene un local alquilado en una avenida de San Juan  tiene una librería donde ofrece servicios  de fotocopiadoras, anillados y artículos para oficina. Ella es cosmiatra  por las tardes trabaja en un spa 
Marivel necesita 2200 soles, para la compra de artículos para oficina, papeles, fólder, tintas. 
El préstamo ayuda a que pueda estar  surtiendo  su librería  y pueda aumentar su capital.
El sueño de Marivel es tener un local propio para su negocio en un lugar mas céntrico.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Marivel is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She has a rented shop on San Juan Avenue in which she operates a bookstore that also offers office supplies, photocopying, and ring binding services. In the afternoons, she works as a cosmetologist at a spa.

She needs 2200 soles to buy office supplies such as paper, folders, and ink. The loan will help her restock her bookstore and increase her operating capital. Marivel dreams of relocating her business to a more central location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase office supplies (paper, folders, & ink)

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona B. is a CEVI client for a quite long time already. She is a sari-sari store owner where she sells variety of goods since 2005. Her customers are people around the village where she resides. She has three children and 19 years old the eldest. 

She needs additional capital of Php 23,000  for her business growth. She thinks of buying additional merchandise to attract cuctomers and improve her income as well.

She is hoping that she will get a loan to support her business. She preferred CEVI because it only has small interest rate of 2% a month and they are really concern to people to grow their small business like hers.

loans.use: additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a blacksmith for the past two years when he had to start helping with the family income. Today, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to improve his business through the purchase of needed merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada J. is currently in the business of selling charcaol and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Ada is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El grupo “27 D. Mayo” esta representado por la señora I. y conformada por 15 miembros que van cumpliendo un ciclo mas demostrando solidaridad, responsabilidad y ganas D. seguir creciendo. Una mayoría D. los socios se dedican a ala venta D. diferentes productos como  juguetes, comida, refrescos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, pan y a actividades como gomería, confección D. prendas D. vestir, transporte y uno D. los socios es policía D. la unidad D. trancito. La competencia en sus rubros y en su localidad no es mucha por lo que pueden obrar con libertad pero nunca falta las época baja D. ventas y para esto algunas utilizan su capital para vivir es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para volverse a capitalizar y para poder aumentar su mercadería, sus insumos y en especial para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo como por ejemplo el señor Roque quiere independizarse y empezar una gomería propia con la compra D. sus herramientas D. trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia los socios han demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos y sobre todo muchas ganas D. seguir creciendo es así que la institución les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.en: Tabriz was born in 1977. He lives in the Fuzuli region. This young man is married and has one child. He has been in the house repairing business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy necessary supplies and tools to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary supplies and tools to improve his business.

loans.name: Blanca Zorayda

texts.es: La señora Blanca Zorayda es casada con el señor José González y son un matrimonio muy emprendedor, ellos tienen su propio negocio de nombre “Abarrotes N. “ establecido desde hace 5 años, y están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Zorayda is married to Mr. Jose Gonzalez. They are entrepreneurs and have their own business called "Abarrotes Nino" which they started 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan that willbe invested in the purchase of merchandise to restock the business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nuria Elizabeth

texts.es: Nuria Elizabeth M. G. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Nuria posee una tienda de productos perecederos, venta a través de la cuál logra solventar los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Es por ello que Nuria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como jabón, golosinas, refrescos y otros más, los cuales le permitan percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nuria Elizabeth M. G. is 35 years old and a resident of the department of La Libertad. She lives with her life partner and their three dependent children. Nuria has a store where she sells perishable goods. She started this business as a means of helping her husband cover the household expenses.

Nuria is requesting a loan so that she can buy additional products such as soap, candy, soft drinks, and other items to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Mohamad has been working as an electrician since 1999. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition especially because he wasn’t really known in his region. Mohamad is special in his work because he is trustworthy and is known for his good work. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires for his work. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
PRIMICIA es un grupo de 9 integrantes que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo ya que todas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de ropa de bebe, cosméticos, costura de ropa y venta de juguetes. Sobre todo en esta época del año necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios ya que la demanda ha subido. Además ellas desean participar de los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, como es la capacitación y la tención en el consultorio, llevando a sus hijos para el control de peso, talla,  fluorización y otros.
Ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal Santiago II.
texts.en:
PRIMICIA is a group of 9 members that came together recently to request funding. Each has her own line of work, such as: baby clothing sales, cosmetics, seamstress, toy sales. Especially at this time of the year, funding is needed to invest in their businesses since demand has increased. Besides, they want to participate in the other services that Pro Mujer offers, like the training and the health services, taking their children in for weight and height monitoring, fluoridation, etc. They gather at the Santiago II Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a member of a communal bank in Cusco consisting of 20 members.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Janet lives with her partner and two daughters (aged 9 and 3) in Cusco. 

Janet owns and runs a furniture store in the Santiago district of the city of Cusco, which she started two and a half years ago.  She learned the trade from her parents, who also own a furniture store.  From her extensive experience in the furniture business, Janet knows that February and March are good months during which to sell mattresses, as these are typically the months when most newcomers arrive in Cusco. With the loan she is requesting, Janet plans to buy mattresses and bedding to sell in her store and hopes to increase her earnings.

Janet appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Janet is pictured with her 3-year-old daughter.

loans.use: To buy mattresses and bedding to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food products

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en:
Marie Goreth was born in 1975. She is married and has two children,  the one was born in 1998, and the last one in 2004. Marie Goreth and her family live in the Gisozi, a region of Gasabo district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Marie Goreth owns a small shop where she sells foodstuffs such as rice, con flour, beans, sugar and some cakes usually bought by children.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours every day except Sunday.

Marie Goreth is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.  Marie Goreth with these additional purchased foodstuffs for sale, she hopes to earn more profits which in turn will be used to reinvest in her business as well as taking care of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs and cakes for sale

loans.name: Ruvilyn's Group

texts.en: Ruvilyn M. is from the city of Calao West, Santiago City. She is 28 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ruvilyn is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Ruvilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Ruvilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her two daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city in Mongolia, and the capital city of the country. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a college student and her youngest daughter is a secondary school student. During the day, she operates a grocery store and she has been doing so since July 2009 after working in well-known restaurants called Haan Buuz and Saran Buuz for eight years.  Before she she moved to Ulaanbaatar in 2001, she had worked as a hairdresser in a public service center in her home province of Bayanhongor since 1987. Bolormaa has been planning to expand her grocery store into a general store, and already has started the preparation. She is focused on the future and says, “I would like to create my own capital.”  She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma L. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 63 years old and married. Norma owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling different products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Serious Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Serious Traders” from the small town of Waterloo. This is where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. These small-scale businesspeople have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to further strengthen their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Chernor S., who is pictured on the left. Born in the Port Loko district, the approximately thirty-three-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have three children who attend primary school. For fifteen years, Chernor has been selling soaps, toothpastes, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, torch lights, cosmetics, etc. With this loan, Chernor will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy soaps, tooth-pastes, tooth-brushes, foot-brushes, torch lights, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Bruno Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. BRUNO,  el socio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio alterna sus actividades con la docencia, Nuestro socio es profesor de primaria, el socio trabaja en la comunidad  Chacán,  en Anta, él socio también trabaja sus terrenos de cultivo sembrando papa. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, entre otros productos; El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y así continuar con su segunda actividad.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION community bank and lives in Anta in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. He is Sr. Bruno, 55 yeaars old and married with 2 children. He alternates between his work as an elementary school teacher in the town of Chacan and work on a farm that he owns where he grows potatoes. His other crops include maize, wheat, barley, vegetables, etc. Bruno is applying for a loan so that he can buy seeds, manure and other supplies for his farming business. Bruno is grateful for the support that this measure provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada tiene 32 años. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Esta casado con el Sr. Eladio Acosta.
La Sra. Ada tiene una despensa en su domicilio propio hace 8 años.
Su marido el Sr. Eladio tiene un pequeño tambo cerca de su domicilio donde tiene 6 vacas lecheras y 2 novillos, se dedica a la venta de leche que quita de sus vacas hace 8 años.
 La Sra. Ada necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas( fideos, harina, azucar, panificados, aceites, arroz y otros) en cantidad a menor precio. 
 En el futuro desean agrandar su despensa y comprar mas ganados para la mayor venta de sus leches y producir también queso.
texts.en:
La Señora Ada is 32 years old. She is married to el Señor Eladio Acosta and has two minor children. She has had a small store in her home for 8 years. Her husband, el Señor Eladio, has a small milking yard near his home where he has 6 dairy cows and 2 young bulls. He has sold milk from his cows for 8 years. La Señora Ada needs this loan to purchase merchandise (pasta, flour, bakery goods, oils, rice, etc.) in quantity and at wholesale. In the future, they would like to expand their store and purchase more livestock to increase milk sales and also produce cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pasta, sugar, bakery goods, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Bakristo Kweterana Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
N. Sarah has been operating her hotel (restaurant) in Birunga, Ibanda, for the last eight years. Hard work, resilience and determination have been her winning factors over the course of these years.

For this married mother of eight, business success depends on hard work and she truly has lived up to it. In a week, she reckons she makes profits that amount to 90,000 shillings.

Sarah’s dream is to open up another branch in another part of western Uganda. This, she figures, will help her make more profits. She also wants to give her children the best education.

With proceeds from this loan, Sarah wants to take rejuvenation measures aimed at improving her hotel and she also wants to start on her plans to setup another branch. She wants to buy more furniture and cutlery for her hotel.

loans.use: To pay for refurbishment of her restaurant and also to buy more furniture and cutlery

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Erdenebayar J., 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a house in Hovd province in western Mongolia. His two children go to kindergarten while his wife works as an accountant in their town. Erdenebayar operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He started his business in 1998. After several successful years in business, Erdenebayar was able to afford to buy a larger, more reliable automobile. He works very hard to provide for his family and to repay his bank loan. Erdenebayar is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina G. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tinago, Bgry. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  raising oysters and farming. Her husband Mateo G., 58 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 8 children who are 23 to  34 years old. 

Florentina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her business and family. The accompanying photo of Florentina and her husband in their wooden boat was taken near the raft where they raise oysters. Florentina G. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 45 años de edad. Es madre soltera y junto a sus 3 hijos ha luchado para salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran ayuda. Su actividad es una pulpería Hace más de 5 años que labora con esta actividad, por lo que es importante para ella. Por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar las tareas del hogar y atender el negocio. Este financiamiento es para las compras de refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes, golosinas y granos básicos. Ella sueña con agrandar el negocio y poder convertirlo en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is 45 years old. She is a single mother who, with her three children, has succeeded in making her way in the world. This is not the first time she has had a loan, and it has been of great help to her. Her business is a grocery store, which she has had for more than 5 years, and which is very important to her. Every day, she gets up early to complete the household chores and attend her business. This loan is for the purchase of local soft drinks and sodas, cleaning products, sweets, and cereals [e.g. rice or maize]. Her dream is to enlarge the business and be able to convert it into a wholesale supplier.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ibtesal

texts.en:
Ibtesal is a 36-year-old working woman from Jineen city. Ibtesal started her own project five years ago. She started a Broilers farm. It's been five years since she started working in this field. Ibtesal gave job opportunities to a lot of her family and city women who needed to make a living.

Ibtesal distributes Broilers to stores and shops in the city and has a good number of customers. As the demand is increasing for her product, she took a $1,500 loan from FATEN to purchase chicks and increase the production.

Ibtesal is at FATEN's office in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash Nyagaya is a 21-year-old boda boda (motorcycle transport) operator in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is married to Roselyne Akoth, who supports his income, and they are blessed with one child.

Joash has been in his business for the last four years and he is doing well. With this, the first loan he is requesting from KADET, he would like to service his boda boda taxi and also purchase more vegetables for his wife’s business.

Joash plans to use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike for his transport business. In the future, he would like to be persistent in business through borrowing, and expand his business to buy a matatu (minibus).

loans.use: To  service his boda boda taxi and purchase vegetables for his wife’s business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is 52 years old, widowed and has two children. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. Susan raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also maintains a rice field. Her children help to keep their crops healthy and the farm productive.

Susan joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that will be used to purchase feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa C. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como unas de las más bellas del Ecuador por su cultura y tradición, cuenta con una gastronomía muy variada, su gente es amable y cordial. 

Doña Narcisa tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada, vive con ella y comparten los gastos del hogar, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. También tiene dos nietos los que pasan a su cuidado cuando su hija sale al trabajo. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Narcisa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada hace 30 años, vende los días sábados y domingos. Vende también cosméticos Yanbal, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 20 años. Trabaja como empleada domestica tres días a la semana.
 
Es nuestra socia hace varios años en la banca comunal y ha llegado tener una muy buena amistad con cada una de las socias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio de cosméticos y ropa.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa C. is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank, she lives in the city of Cuenca, which is considered one of the most beautiful places in Ecuador for its culture and traditions, it has great varied food and its people are very friendly and cordial.

Mrs. Narcisa is 47 years old, is single and has 3 children of 27, 25 and 14 years of age. Her eldest daughter is married and lives with her and shares in the household expenses, the second son works and helps with the household expenses as well and the youngest son attends high school. She also has two grandchildren which she takes care of when her daughter goes to work. Mrs. Narcisa doesn’t own her home which is why she rents.

Mrs. Narcisa has sold used clothing for some 30 years, she sells Saturdays and Sundays. She also sells Yanbal makeup; she has done this for some 20 years. Mrs. Narcisa also works as a domestic employee three days a week.

Our member has been a part of the communal bank for some years and has great friendships with each of the members. Mrs. Narcisa’s new loan will be used to buy more products for her business to sell makeup and clothing.

Narcisa’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothing and makeup.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Leonora is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and instant noodles in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is from the village of Tabon. She is 52 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosario Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosario es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Ella cría vacas y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. En cuanto a las vacas comercializa la leche que estas producen y a las aves de corral las ofrece en venta una vez que hayan alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo. Sus ventas las realiza en el principal mercado de la ciudad.

Rosario desea ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos en su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre se encuentra buscando el modo de sacarlos adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 40 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in Pacasmayo district, a commercial district which is in the province of the same name, in La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosario raises and sells animals.  She raises cows and poultry such as turkeys and hens.  As far as the cows are concerned, she sells the milk which they produce.  She offers her poultry for sale once they have reached a good level of development.  She makes her sales in the town's main market.

Rosario would like to expand her sales and make more income in her business.  For that reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Rosario is a woman who is committed to her family and who is always looking for ways to get them ahead in life.  People who know her like her and have a lot of respect for her.

loans.use: To increase her sales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a soft-spoken woman who is blessed with a 12-year-old child. She sells clothing and bedding for a living.  She previously sold household goods.  Most of her customers are people in her neighborhood. It has been just one year since she started the business, and she has managed to grow it through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to own a business premise instead of renting. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kes to open a boutique.

loans.use: To open a clothing boutique

loans.name: Budondo Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
B. Feibe is a 61-year-old dairy farmer in Namizi-Jinja.  She is one lady with the courage of her convictions. Despite her age, she exemplifies the  diligence often expected in people on the sunny side of 35. Given the fact that most Ugandans in general drink milk, one can reasonably assume that her business is doing well. Needless to say, her business has indeed been making strides in the 13 years she has been operating it. She said to get established in this business, she received training and learned skills from a local agriculture advisory school. 

Feibe also runs a small grocery store in Jinja Market.  Her weekly profits equate to 80,000 shillings. Feibe is happily married with 11 children.  She said with this loan, she will purchase another cow and improve her kraals. She belongs to Budondo Development Association-Jinja.

loans.use: To buy a cow and improve corrals

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 46-year-old Khoem T.’s daily routine. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at their home. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profit. They have been operating this business since 1985. Khoem T. is the mother of two children; one is employed as a garment worker in Kompong Chhnang province and the other is a student. Khoem T. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to purchase some pieces of wood to repair her old house.

loans.use: to purchase some wood to repair her old house

loans.name: Alice Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alice” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age 25; she was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary school. For 10 years now, she has been selling cooked rice, palm oil and uncooked rice. With this loan, Fatmata will buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc., to improve on her business size and quality.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc., to improve on her business size and quality

loans.name: Mujeres De Chu Pop Abaj Group

texts.es: Doña Virginia I. D. 38 años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene cuatro hijos, dos niñas y dos niños, doña Virginia trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la Vender ropa, para niños y adultos con esa actividad ella  ha podido  mantener a su familia, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 7 años, doña Virginia necesita surtir su venta y tratar D. apoyar a su esposo, y así D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace más D.  ocho años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia, si no que también a las personas D. su aldea. Cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. camisolas y pantalonetas, pants, blusas, venta D. mercería, entre otros. Esperan que por medio del creditos que solicitan mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su condicon D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia I. is 38 years old, married, and has four children – two daughters and two sons. She tries to support her family financially and prepare her children for a better future. Doña Virginia sells clothes for children and adults. She started her business more than seven years ago and it has enabled her to support her family. Doña Virginia needs to restock her business so that she can help her husband. This will enable her to generate more revenue. She has gathered together some friends and neighbors who she has known for more than eight years in order to form a group. Not only will this benefit her family, but it will help the residents of her neighborhood.

Each one of these ladies engages in different business activities such as selling fruit, raising animals, making clothes (shirts, shorts, trousers, and blouses), selling sewing supplies, etc. Through the loans they have requested, they hope to increase their incomes and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional operating capital for selling clothes

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling fruits and vegetables and a general store. Her husband Arsenio, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have seven children who are between 19 and 38 years old. Sergia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sergia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,900 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her businesses. Sergia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.Kiva.org

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel tiene 28 años, vive con el compañero y los 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Reyna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  construir la casa.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and 6 children.

The members of 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Reyna is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  

Reyna is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially, to cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to build a house.

Reyna enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: La Sra. Katty vive en la zona del 4to anillo, ella vive en la casa de sus padres junto con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene como negocio una tienda en la que vende sodas, bebidas, algunos abarrotes, y tiene su punto de llamadas, además de vender algunos cosméticos, con lo que vende diario ella ayuda a los gastos de su casa, ya que ella y su esposo tienen como sueño poder comprar su propia casa y así darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.  Su esposo trabaja en una empresa como barnizador de muebles, así que ella aprovecha y le vende a la empresa dos veces a la semana 40 litros de leche para los trabajadores. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que en las mañanas empieza muy temprano a atender y esta por lo general hasta las 23:00 horas con al tienda abierta. Ella necesita el crédito para poder surtir su venta con más abarrotes que es lo que le han pedido los vecinos, luego piensa también comprar juguetes y regalos.
texts.en:
