Bernandita has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase durable motor parts to keep the motor in good running condition, to sustain her livelihood. Bernandita hopes to expand her business and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase durable motor parts to keep the motor in good running condition.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is married and has four children. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Rio is a farmer and grows mangoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for mangoes. 

Rio has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for mango production

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es feriante, compra y vende cereales y animales menores, tiene 3 hijos, y este préstamo lo utilizará para comprar mas animales y cereales para poder venderlos.
Paulina es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 15 años, empezó su negocio con poco capital y gracias a los préstamos recibidos tiene su casa y ha podido educar a sus hijos, lo que mas le gusta es el trato que le dan, a veces con los problemas ella se siente estresada pero cada vez que tiene que venir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal se siente feliz, es su segunda casa, en las reuniones se divierte y aprende tantas cosas que  las inculca despues a su familia, lo que ahora desea es comprar un terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank. She has 3 sons. She is a trader who buys and sells grains and small animals and she will use her loan to buy more animals and grains to sell.

Paulina has been a partner in FINCA Peru for the past 15 years. She started her business with little capital but thanks to the loans she has received she now has her house and has been able to educate her sons. 

What she likes best about her Communal Bank is the treatment she receives from other members. At times she feels stressed due to her problems but each time she has to go to her Communal Bank’s meetings, she feels happy. It is like her second home. She has a good time at the meetings and learns so many things that she later teaches her family. What she now wants is to buy land for her sons.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Guigo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GUIGO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Christine est âgée de 51 ans. Christine n'a jamais été à l'école et à trois enfants dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Christine mène comme activité la vente de maïs et d'igname de façon secondaire.Christine mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Chritine s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,Christine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GUIGO, un cinquième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The GUIGO group is made up of three people who live in the same area of Benin. The representative of the group, named Christine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Christine is 51 years old. Christine has never gone to school and has three children, two of whom are still her dependents. All her children are in school. 

In order to support herself and her children, Christine conducts business as a secondary seller of corn and yams. Christine has been conducting this business for five years. Christine acquires her goods at Benin's largest market. 

On a quest to satisfy her customers and increase her business and her income, Christine, together with the other members of GUIGO group, is requesting a fifth loan. The loans she received in the past have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and yams

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
The Satya Laksana group got a loan for the 4th time. The number of members is 14 and the total loan amounts to Rp.21,000,000. Having been successful with maintaining one sow, Ni Ketut will use this loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork. She will maintain them for two months. Any remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of new deliveries of two sows that she already owns. 

The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but Ni Ketut remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair the home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase four types of local pigs.

loans.name: Chengheng

texts.en:
Chengheng (in the photo) is a carpenter and fisherman, while his wife Saro is a weaver.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three daughters, two of whom are garment workers and another one stays at home. 

Chengheng is requesting a loan in the amount of US$500 to buy wooden materials to repair the house where he lives because it is breaking in some part.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials to repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a thirty-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, John Mtiria, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Gladys has operated a boutique for the past ten months. In addition, she owns a retail shop. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of new clothes and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of new clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Stenely

texts.en:
Stenely is 46 years old, married to Jane and a father of four school-going children. For the past 2 years, Stenely has operated a school with a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client of KADET LTD. Stenely is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy books and pay rent.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide the basic needs for his family. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy books and pay rent

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children; four attend school while three are too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a posho mill machine, grinding maize for flour. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a posho mill machine.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase spare parts, fuel, and pay for a license. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, fuel, and pay for a license.

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en:
Rodelisa is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rodelisa has a retail shop that sells variety of sizes of lumber and timber. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of timber and lumber.

Rodelisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodelisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of timber & lumber

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a widow. Her husband died leaving her alone but she never lost hope and started a beauty parlor business at her home. She is an expert beautician and provides good quality services to her clients who are mostly women from her community.

She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in local school and are receiving their education. Yasmeen works very hard to afford their school fees. She is a great mother and raises her children very well.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her parlor business. With the loan investment, she will buy some furniture to increase the sitting arrangements at her parlor. She will also buy makeup material such as nail polishes, mascaras, eye shadows etc. This will help her to provide better quality customer services and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for sometime now and is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her and she will be able to continue providing education for her children.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, mascaras, eye shadows and furniture for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Nacer, tiene un recreo donde vende comidas típicas, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 20 años, los primeros préstamos que recibió los invirtió en la compra de insumos y algunos equipos para su negocio, gracias a sus  ahorros logró implementar su capital de trabajo, le gusta trabajar con Finca por la facilidad de créditos que le dan, además le ayuda mucho porque es la única que educa a sus hijos, le gusta recibir charlas para poder orientar a su familia y aconsejarlos bien.
el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra cervezas e insumos para la cocina. Su meta es sacar profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nacer” (To Be Born) and has a café where she sells traditional dishes. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 20 years. The first loans she received were invested in the purchase of supplies and some equipment for her business. Thanks to her savings, she has been able to maintain her operating capital. Justina enjoys working with FINCA because of the loan services that are provided. In addition, the loans have been a great help because they are the only way for her to provide her children with an education. She likes the seminars because they have helped her to manage her family and provide them with good advice.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beer and cooking supplies. Her goal is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy beer and cooking supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 32 años de edad casado con Sonia de 34  años, fruto de este gran amor nacieron 4 hijos con los que viven felices en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Julio es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura, cuenta que desde joven aprendió gracias a sus queridos padres, como es el cultivo de café, plátano y cacao, que son cultivos tradicionales. En años anteriores no tenían mucha rentabilidad por los bajos precio que ofrecían los acopiadores, per actualmente estos productos están en su mayor apogeo especialmente el café y cacao que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado exterior, por lo que los agricultores se encuentran contentos en especial julio que en estos 6 últimos años a incrementado sus plantaciones de café. Asimismo sus ingresos incrementaron considerablemente. Ahora les brinda una mejor oportunidad a sus menores hijos. Él está feliz con esta labor que realiza por que gracias a su familia pueda tener todas las comodidades. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por el que agradece y se compromete en cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles invertirá en una nueva instalación de plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Julio is 32 years old and married to 34 year old Sonia, and they have four children together.  They all live happily together in a home of their own, located in the Sivia district.  Julio’s a farmer and he says that he learned this skill when he was a boy, thanks to his parents.  He learned how to raise coffee, bananas, and cacao, which are the traditional crops.  They didn’t make much profit in the past because of the low prices offered by the suppliers, but now these products are their peak, especially the coffee and cocoa, which are in high demand in the marketplace and this makes the farmers happy, especially Julio.  Over the past six years he has been increasing his coffee crop, and so his income has increased considerably.

Now this presents a better opportunity for his younger children.  He’s happy with this job because his family can have all the comforts.  This will be his second loan through MFP and he is grateful and is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 3,000 PEN ($1,125) from this loan to invest in new coffee crops.

loans.use: to plant new coffee crops.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Warlita buys and sells fish in her community. She also sells seaweed on the mainland. Warlita works hard to help her husband provide for their needs. She has requested this loan to buy more seaweed and fish to sell. Warlita hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes that her children are able to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and fish to resell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with one child. Maribeth is 34 years old and resides at Tabid, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Maribeth operates a business in the agriculture sector, planting & harvesting gabi (a "root plant" known in English as Taro)  to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2012, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she hopes to grow her business to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Benkadi Kagoua  8 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi Kagoua  8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  AISSA, assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Kagoua 8 group are married women with an average age of 39, on average 4 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Aissa, sitting in the middle of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for the cultivation of three quarters of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 95 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment, and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Marta Beatriz

texts.es: Marta Beatriz de 45 años de edad,  vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por: su esposo, así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos. Marta se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas,  su negocio está ubicado dentro del mercado municipal de su lugar de residencia, un lugar en el cual hay gran afluencia de personas diariamente. Ella es una persona muy inteligente, ya que desea ir invirtiendo poco a poco para contar con mayor cantidad de productos en su negocio. Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para invertir en su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer más  productos como diferentes frutas de estación, ella cuenta con la gran ventaja de tener varios años de vender en el mismo lugar razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes, por lo que obtiene muy buenas ganancias, y es por esto que ella espera poder contar con más verduras y así aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y verduras para comercializar

loans.name: Nounagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUNAGNON est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Béatrice, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans est mariée à un électricien du nom de Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Béatrice et son mari. Béatrice n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour ce faire, Béatrice vend des friperies de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Béatrice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Béatrice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUNAGNON un troisème crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Ma Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa agradece su primer financiamiento ya que gracias al mismo logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados en sus cultivos de café con los cuales asistió muy bien la propiedad. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad. Gracias a ello su producción de café fue un éxito logrando vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el compromiso con la institución en su totalidad. Actualmente Doña Teresa solicita ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para re-invertir en sus cultivos de café los cuales después de la corta del grano y recolección del mismo quedaron deteriorados y expuestos a ser contagiados por la roya o por plagas que conlleven a la tala de los mismos una vez dañados.

loans.use: Para compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada.

loans.name: St. Balikuddembe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sister Florence. She is Head Teacher of St. Balikuddembe School, a mixed school in the rural area of Buloba with 200 students.

St. Balikuddembe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Balikuddembe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sister Florence ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on his stock.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is married with two children. One attends school. Joice was educated until level 7 when her parents passed away and she could no longer afford the school fees. She started her food business one year ago with capital of $100 which she got from her husband. She deals in both wholesale and retail in different markets.

Given the loan, she plans to buy tomatoes in bulk to maximize on profit. The loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Daniela Macrina

texts.es:
Daniela is from Monclova, Coahuila, she is married and she has a small son. Her husband is employed as worker at a factory, since his salary is very low they began having many economic problems. In order to help his husband with the family’s expenses, Daniela started selling footwear a year ago . She was first selling to her neighbors and relatives and little by little she has increased the number of clients. Daniela is asking for a loan of $150 to cover the demand of her growing clientele; she will use the money to buy merchandise. She will repay over a period of 3 months. You can help with the growth of this business, and the well-being this family, they are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniela es originaria de la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica, su salario es muy bajo y comenzaron a tener muchos problemas económicos, para poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar Daniela comenzó a vender calzado hace un año, inició entre sus vecinos y familiares y poco a poco fue ampliando su número de clientes. Para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Daniela solicita un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, y al bienestar esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Adrian Arnoldo

texts.es:
"I was given a home to live in but I've not been able to move into it yet because I need to make it secure for my family. I work the night shift and my wife has to stay alone with the children in the house. It is not a good area and there are lots of trouble makers. I am asking for $700 to make my house more secure."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

“Me dieron una casa de interes social pero no he podido habitarla ya que necesito ponerle antes las protecciones, más que nada por la seguridad de mi familia, yo trabajo en el turno de noche y mi esposa se quedaria sola con mis hijos y no quisiera que les fuera a pasar algo debido a que en ese fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes”.Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la colocación de protecciones en mi casa.

loans.use: Security for his house

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu took out her first loan to start her sewing business from home. She is married with several children to put through school. She specializes in making dressy shirts and Puletasi (a Samoan-style dress). She has a good track record with her loans, having already paid off her first loan of $300. She is now applying for her second loan of $500, which she plans to use to purchase material, buttons, and other supplies for making more T-shirts and puletasi. Her profits have increased from $96 from the time she joined the loan program, to $140 profit now. The improvement of her business has really helped her family meet its daily needs.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, materials, and other supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: I am Ayesha B. from a small city, Arifwala, Pakistan. I am 33, married and a mother of five children: one girl and four boys. All of my children attend school except the youngest, who is currently too young to attend school. My husband operates a grocery store in a more busy and crowded nearby market. My children are growing and so our expenses. We feel the need of an extra income now. Therefore, my husband wishes to expand his store and buy a few items such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc. in bulk. We would like a loan of $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy items such as cooking oil, rice, and sugar in bulk for the store

loans.name: Soa

texts.en:
Mrs. Soa C. O., 42, is the mother of three children and works at a market selling a variety of grocery products and shoes, earning on average around US$ 5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works driving a motor-taxi, making about US$ 5/day. Two of her children are enrolled in school and the other is still too young to go to school.

Mrs. Soa C. O. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory so as to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory and meet her growing customer demands

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S., age 63, works raising poultry and reselling them to the brokers in her area, making on average around $4 each day in revenue. (Her son is pictured in the photo as she was too shy to be photographed.) Her husband, 65, works driving a motor-taxi to transport passengers. They have two children who work growing a variety of vegetables to raise her family’s income generation. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a rice-grinding mill. This will allow her to charge neighboring farmers to husk their rice and to increase income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-grinding mill to generate additional income.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
When her husband was left without a job because of an illness, Aida searched desperately for a way to pay the bills of her home and the medical bills of her husband, who suffered from diabetes.

At first, because of a lack of resources, she bought her merchandise at retail prices, by the kilo. Little by little, with the help of one of her daughters, she increased her sales and started to buy larger quantities of her products. She says that this business isn't going badly for her, but she does earn very little compared to the work and effort she puts into her business every day. Upon having the opportunity of receiving financial support, she would like to open a bazaar and sell clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo a causa de una enfermedad, Aida buscó desesperadamente la forma de mantener los gastos de su vivienda y la salud de su esposo, quien padecía de diabetes.

En un inicio, Aida por falta de recursos, compraba su mercadería al por menor, por kilos. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de una de sus hijas pudo aumentar sus ventas y comprar por mayores cantidades sus productos. Ella afirma que no le va mal en este negocio; sin embargo, asegura ganar muy poco comparado al trabajo y esfuerzo que pone a diario en él. De tener la oportunidad de recibir un apoyo financiero le gustaría abrir un bazar y vender ropa en el mismo mercado.

loans.use: To begin constructing a clothing bazaar.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is an exceptional wife and mother as, although she cannot count on any income from her husband due to his bad health (he has a bad back and cannot move normally), she does the best she can to get through their problems and help him to recuperate. She would like a loan to be able to improve her small shop, and thereby increase their income and her beloved family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

MARGARITA, es una esposa y madre excepcional porque a pesar de no contar con los ingresos de su esposo quien se encuentra delicado de salud por un mal que tiene en la columna y que no lo deja desplazarse con normalidad; hace todo el esfuerzo posible para desempeñarse sin problemas con la esperanza de ayudarlo a recuperarse pronto. Con el deseo de mejorar su desempeño en su pequeña bodeguita, solicita un préstamo para incrementar sus ingresos y el nivel de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: To increase capital to offer more products in his small shop/Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos en su pequeña bodega.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a hardworking woman who has always fought to better the wellbeing of her young five-year-old. With this great desire inside of her heart she became qualified in the study of the food industry and makes yogurt and diverse dairy products that she sells in the areas of Porvener and Huancan every day going from door to door. She has worked arduously for five years and wants to have a small dairy products company in the future to increase her income. She will continue with her intensive work and asks for a loan to upgrade her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por mejorar y otorgarle bienestar de su pequeño de 5 años, con este inmenso deseo dentro de su corazón se capacitó estudiando industrias alimentarias y elabora yogurt y diversos productos lácteos que vende por la zonas llamadas Porvenir y Huancán todos los días de manera ambulatoria de puerta en puerta; lleva 5 años de ardua labor y desea a futuro poder tener su pequeña empresa de productos lácteos para así mejorar sus ingresos, seguirá con su trabajo intensamente y solicita un préstamo para repontenciar su negocio.

loans.use: Increase in capital to upgrade her activity

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Neema M.. She is married, and has three children ages 9, 14, and 17. She also has one dependent. Neema owns a piggery business, and requests a loan in order to purchase additional pigs and feed. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. Toni Fatoumata K. is a 45-year-old wife and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband (driver-mechanic) and her children in the Bougoufié district of Ségou.

Born into a family of merchants, she has been learning about commerce since her childhood. She became specialized in selling second-hand clothing (worn clothing from developed countries), this for fifteen years. She gets her inventory locally in Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. She intends to use this loan to diversify her sources of inventory by buying a bale of brassieres, a bale of clothing, and a bale of bedsheets in BURKINA FASO (supposedly of the best quality and inexpensive).

She runs this business in the grand marketplace of Ségou and sells daily to a customer base composed of the inhabitants of Ségou and shopkeepers at the Ségou market each Monday. Sales are done in cash and often on credit. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay the loan interest and to address family needs. Her main concern is paying for a plot of land to live on.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mme Toni Fatoumata K. est une mariée de 45 ans, mère de 4 enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame avec son mari (chauffeur mécanicien) et ses enfants dans le quartier bougoufié de ségou.

Née dans une famille de commerçant elle a appris le commerce dés son enfance. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de friperie (Habits usagés provenant des pays développés) depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et des fois à Bamako. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour diversifier ses sources d’approvisionnement en achetant une balle de soutien gorge, une balle d’habillement, et une balle de draps de lit au BURKINA FASO (supposée de meilleure qualité et de bon prix).

Elle mène cette activité au grand marché de Ségou et vend quotidiennement à une clientèle composée d’habitants de Ségou et de forains fréquentant le marché de Ségou chaque lundi. Cette vente est faite au comptant et souvent à crédit. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 CFA. Qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux besoins de la famille. Son souci majeur est de payer un lot à usage d’habitation.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Ana owns a small retail business in Zanzibar. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children (ages 15, 16, 17, and 22). Each day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business. She earns a monthly profit of approximately $80.

Ana is now seeking a loan to buy more materials for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing additional materials)

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa M. Gonzales is a very hardworking woman from the municipality of Condega, of the city of Esteli. She works very hard in agriculture and cattle and has been doing this for 20 years.

She is now the mother of three children, of whom two are of school age. She has the obligation to support them and take care of all of their needs.

Luisa has applied for a loan from Ceprodel so that she can invest in the maintenance of her farm so that she can have a successful harvest and continue to maintain the house where she lives.

Translated by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luisa M. Gonzales es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica muy esforzadamente a la actividad de ganadería y agricultura habiéndose destacado en esta actividad desde hace 20 años.

Actualmente la señora Luisa es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edades escolares por lo que tiene la obligación de mantenerlos y suplir todas las necesidades que ellos atraviesan.

Hoy en día ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de su finca para llevar a cabo los cultivos exitosamente y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of her farm

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos que son estudiantes, Eugenia vive en la casa de su tío, Eugenia viaja a la selva ayacuchana 2 veces a la semana a comprar hoja de coca de los productores, luego de acopiar lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas lo realiza a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son al contado.

Eugenia Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hoja de coca. Eugenia sueña con tener casa propia, equipar su casa con todas las comodidades y que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Retoño (sprout) Microfinance Institute. Eugenia is a 39-year-old woman with 3 school age children and a live-in partner. She lives in her uncle’s home. Eugenia travels to the Ayacuchan jungle twice a week in order to purchase coca leaves from the growers. After stocking up, she transports the leaves to the city of Ayacucho, where she sells them for a single cash payment.

Eugenia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will invest in purchasing coca leaves. She dreams of having her own home, equipping her home with all the amenities needed, and having a prosperous business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coca leaves

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un C. was born in 1970 and is the mother of three children aged 10, 7 and 5 years old. She and her husband work breeding pigs to generate income. After participating in a training about agricultural understanding and how to breed pigs and poultry properly, conducted by a CEDAC, a local organization, this couple has a lot of idea and wanted to try to improve their living conditions.

Initially, they started buying only a few pigs to breed because they had not enough capital. Pig breeding is doing well for them and they are willing to purchase a few more pigs to raise. After hearing from their neighbor about CREDIT MFI from which they could take a loan to use for their livestock expansion, this couple has asked for a $1000 loan to help them purchase more pigs and a motor-bike to use for their business transportation.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to breed and a motor-bike to use for their business transportation.

loans.name: Mary M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Mary M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 1 child, age 32. Mary has been running a shop since 2006. Her business is selling items like rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, etc.

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her sister-in-law and 1 daily worker. Mary currently earns about $177 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to purchase more items in bulk for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more items in bulk

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr: Né vers 1956 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  H. Paul est marié et père de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 190 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1956 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Paul H. is married and the father of 8 children, of whom six are attending school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and a member of the GH Missimahou group of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the Ouémé River is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Paul H. has requested a loan of 190,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 2 hectares, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Mme A. Jeannette est née en 1970 à Kpalimé. Veuve avec deux personnes à charge, elle a du mal à se prendre en charge car n’ayant aucune source de revenu. Elle entrepris alors la vente des denrées alimentaires notamment, du riz, le poisson fumé, les jus et de l’eau glacée. Ce qui lui réussit très bien. Compte tenu de la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle sollicite un financement pour faire le stock considérable de riz, acheter du poisson régulièrement en grande quantité et élargir son commerce à d’autres activités. Les bénéfices lui permettront désormais de se prendre convenablement en charge et veiller aux bien être de ses deux enfants orphelins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanette A. was born in Kpalimé in 1970. She's a widow and has two persons to support. Lacking a source of income, she started selling food products, notably rice, smoked fish, juices and iced water, a business that works well for her. Since customer demand is ever-increasing, she's seeking a loan to stock large amounts of rice, purchase large quantities of fish on a regular basis, and expand her business to other activities. The profits will enable her to adequately provide for herself and to ensure the well-being of her two orphan children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and fish for her food products business

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn N. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a duck breeder.  Her duck business is going well, and she wants to expand. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ducks to breed. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Pho Kosal, is a farmer cultivating rice on a piece of land he owns. 
Mrs. Khorn N. is 49 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are employed in different positions, two are farmers and help their parents and three are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.ru: Обидчон мужчина 39 лет, отец троих детей , жена портниха на дому.Сам Обидчон много лет как зарабатывает на жизнь заготавливая и продавая мясной шашлык.он выпекает несколько видов шашлыка.Его продукция  пользуется большим спросом ,т.к. отличается от других высоким  качеством и вкусом. Получив кредит он хочет отремонтировать свой ларёк, обновить навес.Для чего ему понадобилось 1600 сомони.
texts.en:
Obidjon M. is 39, married. He has 3 children. Obidjon's wife works as tailor at home. For many years, Obidjon M. has been making and selling kebab. His kebab is in great demand for the taste and quality. This loan Obidjon will use to renovate his stall.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of the place of business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Fatuma H J. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. Additionally, Fatuma has been running a charcoal business since 2002. She sells charcoal, which is a small, black piece of dry earth used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative!

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, six days per week. Fatuma currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal stock. In the future, she plans to increase her stock. Fatuma thanks you for her support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Санчаров Улугбек мужчина 30 лет , женат имеет троих детей. Жена не работает занимается уходом за детьми. Сам Улугбек работает в колхозе на поле , его работа заключается полив полей. Кроме этого он занимается бизнесом животноводства.
На данный момент у него оборотный капитал очень большой, 30 коз и все они с козлятами.Во время мониторинга Улугбек как раз кормил коз.На  деньги кредита Улукбек хочет купать ещё пару десятков коз.Его жена занимается производством козьей пряжи.
texts.en:
Ulugbek S. is a 30 year old man, he is married and has three children. His wife does not work and takes care of the children. Ulugbek works at a collective farm in the fields, he waters the fields. In addition, he raises livestock. He currently has a lot of capital in circulation – he has 30 goats and all of them have baby goats. During loan monitoring, Ulugbek was feeding his goats. Ulugbek would like to use his loan to purchase 20 more goats. His wife weaves goat yarn.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 goats

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis A. L. tiene una tienda  y taller de vidrieria, en la casa de su padre, el trabaja desde hace 10 años, muy dedicado al oficio, en la colocacion de vidrios, realiza trabajo en puertas, ventanas y boxes de baño, es un joven soltero, que colabora con la mantención de la familia.
Por esa dedicación al trabajo llego a adquirir con sus ahorros una tienda donde instaló juegos en red e Internet, además de puntos de llamadas, es cliente recomendado por su hermano Juan A. quien es cliente de Emprender desde hace más de tres años.
Solicita este crédito para aumentar maquinaria en su taller, es una persona responsable según referencias.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis A. L. has a glass shop and studio at his father's house. He has worked there for ten years, is very dedicated to the craft and the installation of glass, he produces doors, windows and bathroom stalls. He is young and unmarried, he works to help maintain the family. Therefore he is dedicated to his work, and with his savings has come to acquire a store where he installs internet and web games, and further call points. He is a customer who was recommended by his brother Juan A., a customer of Emprender for more than three years. He requests a loan to increase his shop machinery, he is a responsible person with references.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grinder and a compressor.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Rachael K., who lives in the town of Mwanza.  She is single and has two children, aged one and five. For the last year, she has earned a living making clothes for women. Rachael works at this business for 12 hours per day, six days per week, and earns about $220 a month. She is applying for a loan of $400 to buy another sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rachael thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, which is why they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Nachia

texts.en:
Nachia has been a bites (maandazi and bread) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Uvivu si kazi group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Nachia is 36 years old, married, and has seven children, aged betwee 18 and 3. She also cares for one other dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
S. Khurshed was born in 1984 in Istaravshan. He is married and his young wife takes care of the family and does not work. Khurshed is engaged in commercial service and trade (he trades in salads, cabbage, peppers). He applies to KIVA with the request of the business support loan of 1000 STJ. He brings the goods from Khujand (2nd largest city in Tajikistan). This is his first loan from “Arvand”. He intends to use the funds to expand his trade so that it permits him to increase the assortment of goods and, accordingly, the business turnover. Khurshed wishes all the best and thanks for the business support. 

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services, to the population of Tajikistan. Following each step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” seeks a transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October 2008, MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To expand his inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and she is divorced with four children. All her children are currently in school. Mary is going through thick and thin, struggling to take care of her family. She is supportive, determined and above all very hardworking. 

She is a petty trader who trades in bags of maize. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling maize has enabled her to rent accommodations for her family. She wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells clothes. She lives in Lagos, Nigeria. Joy is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She is hoping for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lotolua

texts.en: Lotolua F. (0) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Saoluafata. She is single and does not have any chlidren. Lotolua owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Lotolua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Mariama Bagna

texts.fr: Mariama Bagna D. est une femme âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des tissus teintés « Thioup » et de l’huile de palme. Son objectif est de contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
36-year-old Mariama Bagna D. is married and the mother of four children. She sells “Thioup” dyed fabric and palm oil. Her goal is to contribute to her family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell "Thioup" dyed fabric and palm oil

loans.name: Gouby

texts.fr: Gouby D. est mariée, 59 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires dans une boutique qu'elle tient. Ce prêt lui servira à développer son activité et les revenus générés à assurer les soins de santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Commerce de produits alimentaires dans une boutique

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D., 37 years old, owns a 3/4-hectare (approx. 2-acre) rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato with a maximum harvest of 120 sacks. She has seven children and the eldest is 18 years old. She receives Php 100 per day from her tricycle but not enough to finance her rice field.

Divina is now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to enable her to buy materials necessary for her rice field.

Divina joined CEVI in 2008 and says that it will help her a lot to sustain her children’s tuition fees. Also her farm will be financed with only a 2% interest rate, which is a lesser burden to repay.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Elia Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02  hijos, vive en el Sector Central, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (3er grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, el cual será vendido en la feria semanal, la señora Celia se ayuda con las chacras y también teje chompas.

Su mayor deseo es comprar mas ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a rice farmer. It puts a smile on her face when she knows her farm is in good condition. She is 45 years old and married to Salvador. They have four children; the eldest is 20 years old. 

Still in need of fertilizers and other supplies, she applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She became a member in August of 2008, and is grateful for the financial assistance she and her fellow farmers were able to obtain. She said that because of CEVI’s program, she learned how to save and pay back at the exact time. She also thinks of its microinsurance program as a great benefit to her and her family. The loan she applied for will be used to fund her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La señora Griselda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabón, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 51 años y es madre de 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Griselda, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Griselda, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Griselda belongs to the “Los Diamantes” community bank in the district of Eslabón, province of Huallaga, department of San Martín. She is 51-years-old, has a domestic partner, and is the mother of 5 children, all of whom live on their own. Griselda is a woman who enjoys working, therefore she decided to open her own business selling carbonated soft drinks located in a well-equipped part of her home. She oversees the business on her own behalf without a schedule or supervisor. She says that she started out with 300.00 soles and began by buying 5 packs of soda; she saw that things were going well but that she lacked more soda, so, little by little, she began investing more. Nowadays, she maintains the same business and is well-known by her customers. This loan of 2,000.00 soles ($700) will be used to buy more beverages, such as soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Griselda has many goals for her future, and she feels very motivated to put her plans into action. She is grateful that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave her help when she most needed it, and she responsibly makes her payments and plans to continue doing so.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packs of soda

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es:
La Srta. Rosario Cristina Gonzáles C. tiene 31 años de edad vive con sus padres y con su hermana en Pueblo Joven Sr. De Los Milagros – Ica. 
Se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas hace 10 años aproximadamente en el horario de 7:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm ya que sus padres siempre se han dedicado a este negocio pero por motivos de salud tuvieron que dejarlo y ella continuó. También vende golosinas y gaseosas en su mismo kiosco  el cual queda ubicado fuera del mercado Toledo en la Av. Arenales Ica.
Este mercado es bien transitado y por eso le rinde diariamente lo cual le permite ayudar a sus padres quienes en la actualidad no trabajan.
Fueron afectados por el terremoto y solo a podido levantar su cuarto de adobe que es donde habita. 
La joven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajadora y buena hija.
Está solicitando el apoyo para así poder invertir mas en su negocio; es decir, comprar revistas y todo lo relacionado a navidad pero también desea incrementar mas en la venta de golosinas y otros ya que es algo que le rinde y le ayuda a cubrir otras necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Ms Rosario Cristina G. C. is 31 and lives with her parents and sister in Pueblo Joven Sr. De Los Milagros, in Ica. For approximately the past 10 years she has been selling newspapers and magazines between 7 am and 3 pm. Her parents had always been in this business but they had to stop because of health reasons but Rosario is continuing. She also sells candy and soft drinks in the same kiosk that is located outside the Toledo market on Arenales Avenue in Ica. This market has a lot of traffic and thus she does well every day, enabling her to help her parents who are currently not working. They were affected by the earthquake and have only been able to rebuild one room in their adobe house which is where she lives. Her neighbors give her good references saying that she is hard-working and a good daughter. She is asking for the help so that she can invest more in her business. That is, to buy magazines and Christmas items. She also wants to increase her sales of candy and other things since they sell well and help her cover the family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of magazines and candy for her business

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, el señor José Marcelino D. se ha dedicado a trabajar muy arduamente ya que es cabeza de hogar y padre de familia de un hijo en edad escolar y que tiene el deber de cuidar de él y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

El crédito lo solicita porque desea comprar una paca de ropa para comercializarla ya que piensa que comprando esto logrará vender toda la ropa tanto a damas, caballeros y niños y así obtendrá ingresos por utilizarlos en el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo. 

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado muy prontamente y así continuar en el desarrollo de su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the Department of Estelí, Mr. José Marcelino has dedicated himself to working hard. He is head of a family and father of a school-age son he is obliged to care for, providing the necessary conditions for his studies.

The loan José solicits is to buy a pack of clothing to sell. He believes he can sell this, for women, men, and children, and thus obtain income to utilize in improving the living standards of the family that requires his help.

He hopes that the loan may be granted very quickly so he can continue to advance the family that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A PACK OF CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Keylin Nieve

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León, la dama Keylin Nieves ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones pero está comprometida con el bienestar de su pequeño hijo a quien debe de brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida para que este se desarrolle.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como zinc, perlines y puertas ya que los necesita de mucha urgencia para continuar con la obra de construcción de vivienda y así terminarla satisfactoriamente y tener un lugar digno donde habitar en conjunto con su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Keylin Nieve wants to invest in home improvements, because her house has been in poor condition and she wants to provide a safe place for her child so that he can have a proper home in which to develop. She lives in Telica, León department. The funds she is requesting will be used to buy building materials like zinc sheeting, edging and doors because these are urgently needed in order to continue the building project and finish it satisfactorily thereby having a worthy home to live in with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La Sra. Fanny vive en la localidad de Brecha 7 platanillo ubicado en el municipio de la Guardia distante a 20  km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no cuenta con domicilio propio por tal motivo se encuentra viviendo en la casa de  su madre, tiene un hijo pequeño, su esposo se encuentra trabando en España, y esta en tramite de divorcio, lo cual se le hace mas dura la vida fue una situacion dificil pero ella sigue adelante a pesar de todo ya que tendrá que criar sola a su hijo; su actividad principal es la crianza de chancho, la cual es su única fuente de ingreso. El dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimento balanceado para los animales, para alimentarlos mejor y asi poder venderlos mas caros. 
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgaciondel credito.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in Brecha 7 Platanillo in the La Guardia municipality, which is 20 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She does not own her own home; she lives in her mother's house. She has a small son and her husband is working in Spain. She is in the middle of divorce proceedings which makes her life even more difficult. It was a difficult situation but she continues to move forward despite everything since she will have to raise her son alone. Her main commercial activity is raising pigs; this is her sole source of income. She will use the loan funds to buy nutritionally balanced feed for the pigs so that she can nourish them better and be able to sell them for a higher price. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda D., 50 years old, is a rice farmer and has six adult children. She said that she is always praying to God that He will bless her family with good harvests to provide for their daily needs. Recently, she has been busy preparing for the next planting. However, she said, she still needs additional money to complete the process. She would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
At 65 years old, Joram has six grown children and now a four-year-old grandchild. He started farming ten years ago when he retired after many years of employment. His farm is in Ndikwe, near Murang'a, in the Central Province of Kenya. He sells the bananas, milk, and maize from his farm in the local market. He also earns income from his posho mill (pictured with Joram above) by charging other farmers a fee to grind cereals, mostly maize, into flour. The main challenge to his business is a lack of funding for farming inputs such as seeds and manure. Recently, there has also been a poor market for farm produce.
Joram is the chairman of his solidarity group at Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, and completed a previous individual loan for 30,000 KES. He has requested a new individual loan for 75,000 KES to make improvements to his posho mill and expand his dairy farm by buying and insuring a new dairy cow. He aims to improve his income by producing up to 20 liters of milk a day and increase his customer base by offering a better service because he will be able to handle larger quantities of cereals.
Joram says that Juhudi Kilimo has enabled him to get back into the posho mill business and make improvements. He has also been able to acquire a dairy cow and a goat.

loans.use: To buy a cow and improve his posho mill

loans.name: José María

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca las mariitas sector el espino el señor José María O. B. a dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, también establece cultivos de subsistencia como Maíz, Ajonjolí, y sorgo, los cuales a demás de proveerle parte de sus alimentos le aseguran una buena cantidad de ingresos con los que puede desarrollar un poco mas su finca, dichas actividades son realizada con sus cuatro hijas y su hijo los que contribuyen su fuerza de trabajo y dirigen las actividades productivas, sin embargo el señor José María O. B. necesita el crédito para realizar la compra de dos bueyes que le aseguran una gran ayuda en sus que haceres diarios, se le han financiado tres créditos con los que ha mejorado su hato ganadero e incrementado sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo Municipality part of the Las Maritas district in the El Espino sector, Mr. José María O. B. has dedicated the majority of his life to the development of farming and livestock activities. He raises cattle, pigs and poultry. He has also established subsistence crops such as corn, sesame and sorghum which, besides providing part of his nutritional needs, also constitute a good source of income. With his income, he is able to further develop his farm. He does all this farming with the help of his four daughters and his son who contribute the labor and manage the production activities. Nevertheless, Mr. José María O. B. requires the loan in order to purchase two oxen that will be a huge help with the daily chores. His previous three loans have been used to improve his herd of cattle and in this way increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oxen.

loans.name: Julius Tiampati

texts.en:
Julius Tiampati N. is 35 years old. He is married to Yiamat N., and he is a father of two school-going children.

Julius is a wheat farmer, and he has been farming for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to use it to plant twenty acres of wheat, which has proved to do very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming, to increase his wheat production, and buy some sheep to fatten and sell later.

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer, both in wheat farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat planting and buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. Anta provincia D. Anta departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Jerónima,  ella tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella venD. comida en la plaza principal del pueblo, también se dedica en la época D. siembra y cosecha al cultivo D. papa, maíz, verduras; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos e ingredientes para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jerónima, 53, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is separated and has a son. She alternates her work with retail selling prepared meals in the town’s main square. During planting and harvesting seasons, though, she also farms corn, potato and vegetables. She needs funds to buy ingredients and supplies for her business. She is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo D. is a 39-year-old married man who supports his family by engaging in a bakery business. He lives in Brgy. Pangalaycayad, Bindoy, Negros Oriental, with his wife and their four children aged between 6 and 17 years old, all of whom are in school.
Reynaldo has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his bakery business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 PHP.
Reynaldo is now borrowing 19,000 PHP as additional working capital to open additional branches in other places. This will be his seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Reynaldo aspires to elevate his family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital to open other branches

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es: María, de 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, en una casa alquilada ubicada en  una comunidad de la sierra peruana.Por estos meses trabaja en un proyecto de construcción fomentado por el estado peruano, mientras su esposo es docente en un colegio secundario. Desde hace 8 años se dedica  al cuidado de la chacra y para que éstas sean más productivas, como en cada cosecha, les brinda los cuidados necesarios, sobre todo durante los fines de semana. Trabaja desde muy temprano sin descanso, junto a su pareja, ambos aman la agricultura a pesar de tener otras actividades económicas. A María le gusta que sus terrenos estén bien cultivados y protegidos de las plagas, aunque el traslado al mercado de su ciudad sea difícil por el peso de los sacos de tubérculos. Como es una mujer muy laboriosa, para más adelante quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad la papa nativa, que está siendo muy solicitada en el mercado por sus propiedades anticancerígenas, además quiere construir su casa propia, para darle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.Esta es la cuarta vez, que tiene un préstamo con MFP y agradece a todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes le gusta trabajar, porque le han  permitido ser parte de  este grupo honesto y trabajador.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, con el que brindará  el mantenimiento adecuado a  sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Thirty-year old María lives with her husband and two children, in a rented home, in a community in the mountains of Peru. She has been working on a construction project started by the Peruvian government for a few months while her husband works as a docent in a high school. She has been taking care of a piece of land for eight years. She takes care of the land's needs to make it more productive with its harvests, mostly on the weekends. She starts working very early and doesn't rest. Her and her partner both love farming in spite of the fact that they also have other jobs. Maria likes her land to be well cultivated and protected from insects even though transporting [the crops] to her city's market is difficult because the sacks of potatoes are heavy. Because she is a hard worker, she wants to plant greater quantities of native potatoes, which are being sought after in the market for their anti-cancerous properties. She would also like to build her own home to provide her family with an adequate quality of life. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she thanks all of the members of her communal bank, with whom she likes working, because they have allowed her to be part of this honest and hardworking group. Maria plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer which will provide adequate maintenance for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mr. Khom L. is 46 years old and is a villager who lives in Choes village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sam Hun, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. They are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. In this farm, they face a problem because the field has infertile soil and there is not enough water to support their farming crop. Thus, Mr. Khom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support his farming crop. This couple has two children who all are seamstresses in the garment factory. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: Waly Dioulbe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité WALY DIOULBE fait partie du Banc Villageois de VELINGARA FOULBE MAREWE. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier.

Le groupe a été crée depuis le 17 juillet 2006. Les membres se sont organisés par proximité et par affinité. 

Mariama B., tout à fait à droite de la photo envoilée en blanc est responsable du Groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 12 enfants et tutrice de 02 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait de la restauration et son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en denrée alimentaire pour mieux développer son activité. 

Son objectif est de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
The solidarity group WALY DIOULBE is part of the Banc Villageois of Velingara Foulbe Marewe. It is composed of ten women from the same district and was created on July 17, 2006. The group members organized themselves by proximity and affinity. Ms. Mariama B. (at the far right in the photo and wearing a white veil) is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 12 children. She is also the guardian of two others, who are entrusted to her by relatives. Mariama works in food catering. Her loan will enable her to stock up on foodstuffs in order to develop her business further. Her goal is to help cover schooling costs for her children and to help her husband to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying provisions in order to develop her restaurant

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
