Julie D. is from the village of Tinago, Tugas, Baliangao. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julie owns & operates a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Julie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Julie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Julie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 58 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. 

Francisca se dedica a la venta de locería en las ciudades de Urubamba y Curahuasi de forma ambulatoria, los días domingos y miércoles respectivamente. Ella también tiene una pequeña tienda en Izcuchaca donde atiende todos los días. Francisca hace pedido de mercadería a sus proveedores de la ciudad de Lima. Ya son 32 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Francisca que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como platos, tazas y muchas cosas más. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de locería en la ciudad del Cusco.  

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Francisca pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Francisca is 58 years old. She lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their four children. Francisca sells kitchenware on Sundays in Urubamba and on Wednesdays in Curahuasi. She sells in an itinerant manner. She also has a small store in Izcuchaca, which she takes care of everyday. Francisca orders her merchandise from providers in the city of Lima. She has been in this business for 32 years. It is going very well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work. With her next loan Francisca hopes to receive 2,000 soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy more merchandise like plates, cups, and many other things. Her dream is to open a kitchenware store in the city of Cusco. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” Communal Bank has been operating for three and a half years. Francisca has belonged to the communal bank for three years. It is going very well for her. The members are devotees of Taytacho Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they gave the bank that name.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise like plates, cups, and many other things

loans.name: Diokere Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIOKERE ENDAME est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame ADAMA B., debout à droite sur la photo, enroulée d’une écharpe blanche, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle pratique l'embauche bovine et ovine. Elle achète un bœuf et des moutons avec sa coépouse et elles les confient a leur mari qui les engraisses pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter un bœuf est des moutons 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Diokere Endame was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 15 women who are all from the same village. The group members know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. The group is part of the SIWAL Banc Villageois. Mrs. Adama B., standing on the right in the photo, wrapped in a white scarf, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old. She is married and has four children. She is also taking care of four other children who were placed in her care by relatives. She fattens cattle and sheep. She buys one steer and some sheep with her co-wife and they give them to their husband who fattens them for at least 5 months before selling them at weekly markets. With her new loan, she will buy a steer and some sheep. Her goal is to take care of her family's needs, for example, food and health.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a steer and some sheep

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek P. is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His father works and his mother has retired and stays at home. Janarbek used to work in a XacBank in 2008, but since then, he has begun operating a retail clothing business in a rented stall at the Kos Terek local trading center. His relative works as a salesperson in his stall. 

He usually purchases his products from Erlian, a border city of China. He is a very hardworking and calculated person and hopes to have his own store one day. He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more clothes from Erlian so that he can offer more products to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Enshai

texts.en:
Enshai A. is a 51-year-old single mother who lives with her four children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Enshai operates a dairy-production trading business in an indoor stall at the local market. She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has had success in growing her business. She purchases milk at 800 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) per liter and sells back at 1,000 MNT. After many years of operation, she built a successful and stable operation. 

Her two sons work in the construction field during the summer months. In the future, she plans to have her own milk breeding cows as well as her own shop where she will sell her dairy products. 

She said, “My only wish is to be able to build a new house for my kids.” 

Enshai is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan both to purchase dairy products such as milk, mare's milk and yogurt for her retail business as well as to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne C. is thirty years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the barangay of Villaros within the municipality of Bagabag, a part of Nueva Vizcaya province in the Luzon islands. Joanne runs a general store from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Joanne has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joanne joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Joanne successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Joanne is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 9000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku E. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs like maize flour and green vegetables. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and greens like okra for sale.  

Kaku is 48 years old and is widowed.  She has one child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and greens for sale

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is almost 50 years old. She is very active and fulfills her household responsibilities very actively. She lives with her family in a small city called Sahiwal, which is famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She is married to M. A.. He has two businesses. In the morning, he runs a grocery shop, and in the evening he handles his tailoring shop. He has hired some workers in his tailoring shop who help him in completing the orders on time. He pays them a monthly wage.
 
Shahnaz is the mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Both are enrolled in a local school and are studying in different classes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk in order to meet the needs of his customers and increase his sales. He has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his grocery business after investing this money into it. She is a new loan user of Asasah, and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Saline

texts.en:
Saline is a 39-year-old married lady who is blessed with six children. She operates a salon with two employees. She has been running the business for two years.  

Faulu Kenya has helped her to improve her business through financial support. She also sells embroidery works for extra income. She hopes to own a piece of land in the future.  

She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair braids and a hairdryer.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and a hairdryer

loans.name: Victoria Bertilia

texts.es:
la sra. Victoria M. tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a costurar ropa, hace todo tipo de ropa que le piden sus clientes como ser pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos, vestidos etc.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en su negocio tiene todas las herramientas necesarias para la fabricacion de sus prendas de vestir.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de variedad de telas, zíper, hilos, encajes y repuestos para su maquina de costurar,  ya que en todas sus costuras ella pone la tela.
en esta epoca de navidad tiene muchos pedidos y desea comprar todos los materiales necesarios para fabricar todas las prendas que sus clientes le han encargado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria M., 57, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood and is a seamstress.  She makes all kinds of clothes that her customers request like pants, shirts, blouses, coats, dresses, etc.

Her business is located in her home.  She has all the necessary tools to make clothing.

She will use the loan to buy an assortment of fabric, zippers, thread, lace and sewing machine replacement parts because she supplies the fabric for all her creations.

During the Christmas season she has many orders and she wants to buy all the necessary supplies to make all the items her customers have ordered.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, zippers, needles and sewing machine replacement parts.

loans.name: María Felix

texts.en:
María is a 56-year-old mother of five who lives with her husband and son in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural community in central Costa Rica. 

María has a business selling catalog items door-to-door in her community. María dedicates the time she can, usually afternoons, to selling cooking pots and microwaveable plastic containers to acquaintances, friends and neighbors. María hopes to use this loan to make investments in such products. She has been earning a living in this way over the past four years. The only obstacle she faces is a lack of access to working capital funds, which she needs in order to make payments up front for the products she sells to her clients, often on credit. 

María has been a client of Fundación Mujer for a number of years. This, however, will be her first individual loan. In the past, María has demonstrated an exemplary ability to make punctual repayments. She is a caring daughter, mother and entrepreneur, in charge of the care of her mother and, since the beginning of this year, her father as well. Despite her non-business responsibilities, her list of clients is growing and revenues are increasing. This can be attributed to her natural tendency to work hard, and her dedication to her family.

María's main goal is to establish a better way of life for her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of microwaveable containers and cooking pots

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and one child, who is attending school. He's been working as a brick cleaner for 25 years. In 1990, he decided to work on his own, offering floor polishing to customers. He works closely with many construction projects and individual jobs to handle his family’s expenses. He works in cooperation with his wife, who has been a tailor since 2006. He obtained a first Kiva loan and, during the loan cycle, there was a health event in the family and, despite the situation, he was able to pay all his bills successfully. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase essential tools to make his work much easier and cleaner.

loans.use: To purchase essential tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una linda niña de tres años y seis meses la misma que es su adoración. El marido es comerciante y agricultor.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a  la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos, lleva cuatro meses que se dedica a esta actividad y dice que le va bien en su negocio. Mientras ella se dedica a su negocio el marido también se dedica al comercio  de CD de música y películas.

Este crédito lo a compartir en dos partes una es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de Yanbal y la otra para el negocio del marido para comprar CD. Este es el quinto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Virgen de Monserrate" communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  The location is known for its traditional culture and the fact that it is just a few minutes away from the best beaches in the province, such as those in San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Mrs. Rosa who is 24 years old and lives with her common-law partner and lovely three-year-old daughter who is the apple of her eye.  Her partner is a merchant and farmer.

She is a homemaker who earns her own money selling Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week on a credit basis with her customers who pay her on a weekly basis.  She receives the products in her home and says her best selling products are perfume and cosmetics.  She has been in the business for four months now and says it is going well.  While she dedicates time to her job her partner sells music and movie CD's.

She plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other Yanbal products, on the one hand, and CD's for her husband's business, on the other.  This is her fifth year with the communal bank and she is very happy with the easy payment terms.  Her dream is to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and music/movie CD's

loans.name: Mrs. Aun Ek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun E. is the president of this village bank loan.  She has been selected by the fourteen people from Sangkae village in TaK. province who make up this group.  The members will use their portion of this loan in varied ways to improve their family's standard of living.  

Mrs. Aun E. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice and vegetables to sell to earn income to support her family.   Her husband, Mr.Thy Chhel, is a motorcycle taxi driver. They support three children who are all studying in the local public school.

Outside farming, Mrs. Aun E. has free time and thus wants to start a new business.  However she does not have money to support this goal.  To achieve her purpose, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets to breed to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita T. is from the village of Crossing Airport, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old.  Perlita is married and has one infant. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling products for daily use, such as snack foods, canned goods,  and dried fish in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Perlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like dried fish and snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Perlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like dried fish & snack foods

location.town: Crossing Airport, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa ha sido bien trabajadora y se esfuerza con brindar el mejor servicio. Su negocio es una librería, desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, De esta manera ha logrado mejorar con el paso del tiempo la producción de sus negocios que llegan a comprar directamente a su negocio, considera que la actividad es muy beneficiosa para su familia ya que tiene disponible el alimento para su propio consumo aunque tiene deseos de incursionar en otro tipo de negocio. El crédito es para la compra de reglas, hojas en blanco, borradores, lapicero, regla, engrapadoras, folders.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa has been quite hard working and she strives to provide the best service.  Her business is a bookstore; she’s had it for over six hears.  She has managed to improve her business over time where customers come directly to buy; she feels this activity is very beneficial for her family because she has food for their own consumption available although she’d like to go into a different type of business.

The loan is to buy rulers, blank sheets of writing paper, mechanical pencils, staplers and folders.

loans.use: to buy rulers, blank sheets of writing paper, erasers, mechanical pencils, staplers and folders.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana G. is divorced and has two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk who makes a living selling clothing in a local marketplace in her home town. The items she sells include terrycloth robes, pullovers, sweaters and jackets. 

Oksana started her business 12 years ago, after she had been downsized out of a job at a manufacturing company. She decided to try her luck in business and has been very successful. Currently, Oksana has one employee. Her monthly profit comes to about 7,000 UAH. 

Oksana is applying for a loan for 16,000 UAH to pay rent for the kiosk and purchase 70 jackets and 50 bathrobes to sell to her customers. She lives with her younger daughter and dreams of some day being able to buy her a home.

loans.use: to pay rent for kiosk and purchase 70 jackets and 50 bathrobes

loans.name: Dul's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 14 members led by Mrs. Dul, who was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Dul is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she grows rice for a living. Because farming does not provide sufficient earnings, she is requesting a loan to make Khmer cakes for sale to improve her ability to support her family.

Dul, a widow born in 1970, is the mother of three children, all students who also help their mother in her business.

loans.use: to make Khmer cakes to sell.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Bernardo; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de negocio de artesanía, el vende artesanía en el distrito de Chinchero, el socio vende mantas, chompas, chalinas y collares en las distintas ferias el socio por medio de este quiere sacar adelante, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the "Mateo Pumacahua" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Bernardo is 33 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling handicrafts.  He sells handicrafts in Chinchero district.  He sells blankets, sweaters, scarves and necklaces in the different street markets.  Through this business he would like to get ahead in life.  He would like to expand and improve his business selling handicrafts.  He is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts wholesale.

Bernardo is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts wholesale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of perishability of products and seasonality in her business. Halima dreams of becoming self reliant and owning her  business premises in the future. 

She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, vive con su esposo y dos hijas, se dedica al comercio de ropa, medicina natural y cosméticos, esta venta la realiza de forma ambulante, recorre varios caseríos y cantones ofreciendo sus productos, esta actividad le ayuda a tener ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, ropa interior y cremas, lociones, maquillajes, con esta inversión podrá ofrecer a los clientes, variedad de productos para su demanda.
El objetivo de Ella es que el negocio sea rentable en el largo plazo y ayudar a su familia para superarse poco a poco de su actual condición.
texts.en:
Timotea lives with her husband and two daughters. She is an itinerant vendor of clothing, natural medicines, and cosmetics. She travels to different villages and hamlets offering her products. This work helps her have income to take care of the her household's needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, undergarments, creams, lotions, and makeup. With this investment, she will be able to offer her clients a variety of products to meet their demands. Timotea'a goal is for her business to be profitable in the long run and to help her family improve their situation little by little.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, undergarments, creams, lotions, and makeup

loans.name: Municipal D-4 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUNICIPAL D- 4” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gladys. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de estebia, distribución de productos, venta de cosméticos, comercio papa y arroz, venta de comida, elaboración de calzados, librería, venta de ropa, tienda de estuco, tejido de mantas

La señora Gladys, indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación de la promoción en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de estuco que aprendió de sus papás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de estuco), este material lo adquiere de las ferreterías y lo comercializa en la zona Lagunas, de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y  tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The "Municipal D-4" community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Gladys.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: running a neighborhood store, selling stevia, distributing products, selling cosmetics, selling potatoes and rice, selling meals, making footwear, running a stationery store, selling clothes, running a store selling plaster and knitting blankets.

Gladys tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles.  She joined through an invitation she received during some promotional activities in her area.  She currently has a business selling plaster.  She learned this business from her parents.

Gladys will use this loan to increase her capital (buying plaster).  She buys this material in hardware stores and sells it in Lagunas district, from Monday to Friday.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family.  Gladys lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy plaster

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa sells traditionally made soaps and pampers.  She is married and has 7 children.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

She uses her income to support her partner in the general upkeep of the home.  She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Sagrada Familia es denominado el comité conformado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se organizaron ya que el programa de mujeres emprendedoras les gusto mucho.
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo. Manifiestan que trabajan muy bien todas juntas pues si surge algún imprevisto entre ellas, tratan de solucionarlo juntas, así el problema será menor.
La Señora Maria vende dulces, se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo por lo que ya tiene una clientela definida. Personas de muchos lugares vienen a comprar de ella los productos que ofrece. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda, lo cual le es muy bueno por los ingresos que recibe. A ella le gustaría, en el futuro, poder tener una dulcería.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes para sus dulces, como ser azúcar, colorantes, polvos y demás. Desde ya agradece la oportunidad que tiene a la Fundación.
texts.en:
'Sagrada Familia' is the name of this committee which is made up of 11 women from the city of Caacupe.  They are friends and neighbors who live in this city and they formed a group as they really liked the Entrepreneurial Women Program.

The committee is currently in its second loan cycle.  The members say that they all work very well together and if any problem arises between the them, they try to solve it together in order to lessen it.

Maria sells sweet treats.  She has been in this business for quite some time.  People from many places come to buy her sweet treats.  She says that she has a lot of demand which is very good as it makes her good income.  In the future, she would like to be able to set up a confectionery store.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for her sweet treats such as sugar, dyes, powders, etc.

loans.use: compra de azúcar, colorantes, saborizantes y demás.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say is a 46 year old domestic farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Since 1997, Mrs. Say has primarily supported herself through her farming business and is making an income around $1.4 each day to use for daily expenses.  Her husband works in the construction field as a domestic construction worker, and earns a profit around US$1.5 a day to share with his wife. In order increase her income, Mrs. Say would like to ask for a loan to buy some ducklings and duck food for breeding.  Mrs. Say has four children, all of whom are single, two of whom are working in a shoe factory.

loans.use: to buy duck-foods and some duckling for breeding purpose.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is separated from her husband and has 3 children. 
To earn a living, Elsa has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Elsa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Elsa would like to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira:D. 45 años D. edad ella se dedica a la venta D. productos comestibles por mayor, inicio su negocio hace 20 años dia con dia a crecido su negocio ella viaja al exterior a traer su productos por mayor ya que si compra por mayor le dan mas barato los productos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. productos comestibles, el sueño D. ella es tener un local mas granD. y tener otro local en otra comunidad aledania.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanira, age 45, sells wholesale food products. She started her business 20 years ago, and it has grown day by day. She travels abroad in order to bring back wholesale products because products purchased wholesale are cheaper. 

She is asking for this loan to buy food products. Her dream is to have a bigger store and to have a store in another village.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Haydalina

texts.es: Haydalina tiene 47 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cerdo hace mas de  6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que  no tenía un trabajo estable y decide iniciar este negocio en su vivienda y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas  cerdos.
texts.en: Haydalina is 47 years old.  For over 6 years she has worked buying and selling pigs.  She began this business because she needed to work since she didn’t have a stable job.  She started the business from home with the purchase of one pig.  With so many customers, she has decided to invest more in the business.  The loan is for capital and labor, and is allocated to buying more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Douen

texts.en:
Douen, 56 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer who earns $2 a day. She has two children, one of whom is studying while the other works, earning $3 a day. Every month Douen must spend $30 on food, $2 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $3 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Douen wants to sell groceries from home when she has enough money. She is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house.

Douen's wish is to help her younger child at least to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath (in the photo) is a weaver. In addition, she also buys some cotton and silk products from the weavers in her village and sells them in other places away from her house. Her husband, Set, is a primary-school teacher.

Sambath is asking for another loan of $300 to more purchase cotton and silk products for sale.

The couple has been married since 1979 and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Two children are married and live in separate homes; two assist their mother in the business; and another one is in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk products for sale.

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel Angel; el tiene 66 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatillas, el tiene una tienda donde vende y fabrica zapatillas y en algunas oportunidades también realiza trabajos de artesanía, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cueros y materiales para fabricar los zapatos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Manuel Ángel, 66, belongs to the “Hatun Rumiyoc” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He’s married and has 7 children.  He alternates his daily chores with a business selling sandals.  He has a store where he sells and manufactures sandals; he makes crafts sometimes too.  He works from 8am until 6pm and he’d like to expand and improve the shoe sales business so is asking for a loan to buy leather and supplies to make shoes.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy leather and supplies to make shoes

loans.name: Phamela

texts.en: Eighteen-year-old Phamela is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers. Phamela's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Phamela does her best to improve their rice farm and take care of her child. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Phamela plans to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She has a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for the last four years.

Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, 29, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Sareoun is a silk weaver and her husband is employed at a hotel. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Sareoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase raw silk to produce silk products for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a married man with three children.  He is 41 years old and he has one and half hectares of family farm land.  Jovito generates income through planting and harvesting corn for sale.  His wife also manages their sari-sari store based in their home for extra income.  They both work hard just to keep their children from poor living standards. 

At this time, Jovito wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to purchase farm input such as fertilizers and corn seedlings.  In the future, he is hoping to grow his business for the betterment of the family's daily living.

loans.use: to purchase farm input such as fertilizers and corn seedlings.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es:
Doña Reyna  María tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el departamento de Masaya. Posee  su negocio de venta de comestibles desde hace 8 años, el cual con la ayuda de su familia y la de su esposo ha salido adelante.

Según comenta, con los años ha aumentado su negocio y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de comestibles tales como frutas para elaborar refrescos, jugos enlatados, azúcar, leche, bolsa, chiverías, galletas.

Comenta que su clientela es fija en  comprarle el producto que ella realiza como es el refresco. 

Confía en que el crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto anhela que se desarrolle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna María is 55 years old, and she lives in the department of Masaya.  For the past 8 years she has run a small store selling groceries.  Her family and husband have helped to grow her business and make it a success.

Over the years she has grown her business and thus has approached Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of supplies such as fruit for making fresh juice, canned juices, sugar, milk, bags, small candies and cookies.

In the past she has been a trustworthy borrower, and has purchased the products she needs such as drinks.

Mrs. Reyna inspires confidence that the loan will be put to appropriate use for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for making fresh juices, canned juices, sugar, milk, small candies and cookies.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo tiene 56 años de edad, está acompañado con la Sra. Petrona hace más de 20 años, tienen 6 hijos juntos, todos mayores de edad, lo cuales ya viven en forma independiente.
Pablo se dedica a la explotación de cantera (venta de piedras), realiza las ventas en el mismo lugar a una empresa encargada de realizar empedrados para unir las ciudades. Trabajan con él tres de sus hijos y varios vecinos a quienes les paga por los trabajos realizados.
Actualmente cuenta con buena cantidad de clientela como los comerciantes encargados de venta de materiales de construcción pues él les provee a la mayoría las piedras que se utilizan en la construcción.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos explosivos, los cuales se utilizan para poder romper las piedras. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad  que esta le da.
texts.en:
Pablo is 56 years old and has been with Petrona for more than 20 years.  They have six children together, all adults who live independently.

Pablo works in quarry explosion (rock sales).  He makes his sales in the same place, to a business responsible for making stone pavings to connect cities.  Three of his children and various neighbors whom he pays for the work they do work with him.

Currently he has a good number of customers, such as the merchants who sell construction materials, since he provides them with the majority of the rocks that are used in construction.

He is requesting the loan to buy explosive supplies that are used to be able to break the rocks.  He is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy explosives to use in the quarry.

loans.name: Stephen Wandera

texts.en: Stephen is 45 years old, married and has four children ranging from five to twelve years old. He describes himself as a focused and understanding man. He sells products such as sugar, soap, cooking fat, flour etc. to hotels, restaurants and residents. He is also employed, which adds to his income. His business challenge is insufficient funds. Stephen will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more flour and cooking oil. Stephen's dream and hope is to run a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rafael Eduardo

texts.es: Rafael Eduardo vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; el posee un chalet en un centro escolar que está ubicado cerca de la localidad donde reside, vende panes (perros calientes), hamburguesas, golosinas, bebidas entre otros, comercia para todos los estudiantes y ellos lo prefieren porque siempre tiene todo lo que ellos necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es único se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y paciencia con sus clientes; Rafael es un hombre muy trabajador, visionario y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de encontrar nuevas oportunidades que le permitan encontrar el camino al éxito; una de sus grandes metas es hacer crecer su pequeño negocio pero necesita de capital para invertir en insumos y así aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, embutidos, aderezos, golosinas, bebidas etc. Rafael Eduardo tiene buen record de pago y es muy responsable asegura cancelará la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: pan, embutidos, aderezos, golosinas, bebidas

loans.name: Balkissou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Balkissou, La représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Moudachirou. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Balkissou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges du ménage sont supportées par Balkissou son mari. Pour cette raison, Balkissou vend des produits cosmétiques et des chaussures par la technique de distribution depuis une douzaine d’année. Balkissou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Balkissou ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des chaussures.

loans.name: Solla

texts.en: Solla is 23 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. Solla lives in Kilolo district. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills. Sola requests a loan from Kiva to start a business as a money-transaction agent of M-PESA, Tigo pesa and Airtel Money. The profits accumulated from the loan will help Solla to buy a lot of credit and save cash for transaction services.

loans.use: to start a business as a money-transaction agent

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a married housewife and has three children. Her husband is a bricklayer and both of them decided to start a business because they always wished to be independent. Because of this, they began to sell tacos 5 years ago.

Olivia prepares the food and her husband and sons helps her with the clients and sometimes with home delivery. She is very happy because her business is growing little by little and she wants to grow a little bit more. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of US$475 to purchase merchandise because she wants to prepare dinners for holy days and Christmas and she needs to be prepared. If she is able to obtain the loan, she could take advantage of the season with more sales and better income for her and her family.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Olivia es una ama de casa, con 3 hijos y casada, su esposo es obrero y entre los 2 convinieron en poner un negocio, pues siempre han acariciado la idea de ser independientes, por eso desde hace 5 años iniciaron la venta de Tacos. Doña Olivia se encarga de la elaboración de alimentos y entre sus hijos y su esposo en sus ratos libres la apoyan con la atención de clientes y entrega de pedidos a domicilio. Esta muy contenta pues cada vez es mayor su clientela llegando a comprar clientes de otras colonias. Desea hacer crecer su negocio por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 a 6 meses, para invertir en mercancías, tiene pensado preparar banquetes escolares para las posadas navideñas y necesita estar preparada para ello. De obtener el apoyo, podrá aprovechar la temporada navideña, con mayores ventas y mejores ganancias para ella y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would wish to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Stockfish is the people’s fish in Asaba, Nigeria. Mrs. O. Rose makes her living selling stockfish that she buys in nearby villages. She dreams of seeing her business grow, and therefore needs a loan of US$400.

loans.use: Purchase of more stockfish for sale

loans.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara has her own orchard where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi -Zeyid. Now Gulara needs a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Nimadgon

texts.ru:
Nimadgon S., 48, is married and has 3 children. He has a sales spot at the “Nikhi” market of Kurgan-Tube. Nimadgon has been selling auto parts for 12 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase more spare parts. With the beginning of the sowing season, the demand for spare parts will increase. Local farmers will be able to acquire the parts they need from Nimadgon. Nimadgon plans to repay this loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Соатов Нимаджон, возраст – 48 лет, образование – средее-техничесткое, женат, имеет 3 детеей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Нихи» в городе Курган-Тюбе. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 12 лет. На сумму кредита планирует приобрести запчасти для автотранспортных средств, тракторов, и других механизмов. В связи с началом посевного сезона, вырастает потребность в приобретение новых автозапчастей, так как селхозтехника находящаяся в пользование у местных фермеров находится не в слишком хорошем состояние и постоянно требует замену определенных частей тракторов и автомомобилей. Нимаджон имея торговую точку на местном рынке даёт возможность местным фермерам приобретать необходимые запчасти, что позволяет им экономить их время и денежные ресурсы. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband, who is a scrap dealer. He is hardworking and honest. He requires this loan to expand his business and buy various scrap items in bulk. I am quite good at sewing, and in the future, I plan to use my skills to support my husband. At present, I am a homemaker because my only daughter is very young, and I have to take care of her.

loans.use: Buy scrap items in bulk

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya lives in Pavlograd with two of her grown children. She is a private entrepreneur and sells children’s clothing and footwear in the central city market. Nataliya is a widow and her business is the only source of income for the family. The inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk is very high quality. Nataliya is very friendly which attracts many potential customers to her vending spot. She has been in this trade for 14 years and recently purchased a small store location. Currently, her turnover capital is about $6000. Her net profit is about $800 a month.

Today Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase 30 pairs of shoes and 40 children’s suits. She is hoping to continue growing her business and open a new vending facility selling women’s clothing items. Nataliya is very independent. She has learned to figure out solutions on her own, get all aspects of her business running single-handedly and make quick decisions when faced with challenges. We believe Nataliya’s strong will and perseverance will help her succeed and repay this current loan.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pairs of shoes and 40 children’s suits

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun S. T., age, 34, works with her husband on her plot of farmland growing rice and raising pigs, making together around $10 each day of income. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies to expand her crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies to expand her crop.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" community bank. She sells vegetables and prepared flour (flour from broad beans, dried peas and wheat). Her stand is located in the market in the city of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 boxes of tomatoes, 3 sacks of onions, 3 pumpkins, a sack of potatoes, 12 kilos of broad bean flour, and 12 kilos of dried pea flour.

She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; the oldest is 40 and the youngest 25. All of her children live independently. Her husband works in agriculture and both raised their children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina H. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, ella se dedica ala venta D. verduras y harina preparada (harina D. haba, arvejas, trigo), su local esta ubicado en el mercado, D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo el cual será cancelado en 4 meses , comprará, 3 cajas D. tomates, 3 sacos D. cebolla, 3 zapallos , un saco D. papas, 12 kilos D. harina D. haba, 12 kilos D. harina D. arvejas.

Ella tienen 57 años D. edad es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor D. 40 años y la ùltima D. 25 años, todos sus hijos son independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ambos educaron a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
I am Rani F. from the city of Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl, all of whom are married and live separately, with the exception of one son, who lives with me and is the major breadwinner of the family. To make a living he operates a rickshaw which needs to be replaced with a new one, hence our need of a loan.

The members of the group who will share in the loan are: Sardaran B., who will invest her portion in her furniture business; Tahira A., who wants to fix her rickshaw, and Asiah Y., who is borrowing for the expansion of her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Carmen Odily

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega in Estelí de Nicaragua, Ms Carmen Odily C. makes a great sacrifice to provide the necessary living conditions for her family. For this reason she has decided to improve her home. Upon starting the remodeling and having only put up a single wall, she recognized her lack of economic resources. Today, in order to continue with her project she has decided to ask for a loan from Ceprodel which will allow her to purchase construction materials for her home.

Ms Carmen will benefit enormously through your support because she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions which will in turn help her family's development and give them a worthy roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega en Estelí de Nicaragua, la señora Carmen Odily C. se esfuerza grandemente con el propósito de brindar a su familia (su hija) las condiciones necesarias para vivir. Por ello al ver la necesidad de mejora de su vivienda ha decidido reconstruir su casa de habitación y al haber comenzado con esta labor se vió en la necesidad de detenerse por la falta de recurso económico habiendo solamente levantado una pared en su vivienda. Hoy en día para continuar con esta labor ha decidido solicitar crédito en Ceprodel para obtener el recurso económico que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

Por medio de este apoyo es de suma importancia destacar que la señora Carmen será grandemente beneficiada porque así logrará brindar a su familia las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo y para tener un techo digno donde habitar.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her home

loans.name: Aginesi

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Aginesi N.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 18.

In 2006, Aginesi established her crop wholesaling business. Aginesi needs a loan to buy rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Agbénossi Edem

texts.fr:
Mr. Agbénossi Edem D. was born on march 3, 1980 in Lomé. He is single, and works selling second-hand clothing in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. Since he quit school, he started in this commercial venture to be on his own. He began this business in the year 2000 with some unique pieces of men's clothing; but over the course of time, his business changed, and he included the sale of clothing for women and children. Presently, lacking enough inventory, he would like to prepare for the vacations, which is when he realizes a good turnover according to past experience. To get his supplies, he is requesting this initial loan to buy 3 bundles of second-hand clothing for women, men, and children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Agbénossi Edem est né le 03 mars 1980 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a pour activité la vente de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’école, il s’est lancé dans ce commerce pour pouvoir se prendre en charge. Il a commencé cette activité en l’an 2000 avec quelques vêtements d’hommes uniquement ; mais au fil des temps son commerce voit une évolution et il ajoute la vente des vêtements de femmes et d’enfants. Présentement, elle n’a pas assez de stock mais il désire préparer les vacances pendant lesquelles il réalise de bon chiffre d’affaires par le passé. Pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 3 ballots de friperie pour femmes, pour hommes et pour enfants.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has a business in Zanzibar selling juice, ground nuts, and oil. Every month she makes a profit of about $25 but she is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more materials to sell.

Rizika is married and has six children. Her children are ages 2, 5, 6, 14, 15, and 28.

loans.use: To buy more materials in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona Báez tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre de 85 años de edad. Posee una despensa que logro montarlo en el año 2005, gracias a la ayuda de su hermano mayor quien viendo la necesidad, y las ganas de salir adelante decidió apoyarlos con un pequeño capital así evitar que busque un trabajo para mantener a su madre anciana.

Hoy día su negocio lo posee en su casa propia la cual le permite solventar todos los gastos, y así poder vivir dignamente sin tener que salir de su casa y teniendo bajo su cuidado a su madre.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador.
texts.en:
Ramona Báez is 50 years old. She is single and lives with her mother who is 85 years old. She owns a convenience store which she opened in 2005, thanks to the help of her older brother who upon seeing her need and will to forge ahead, decided to support them with a small amount of capital. In this way, preventing her elder mother from having to seek employment. Today, the business is located in their own home, which allows them to cover all of the house's expenses, and be able to lead a worthy life without having to go out of their home and taking care of their mother. The credit requested is for the purchase of a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua A. is 45 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children. Two of her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuff like maize and gari in the local market to her loyal customers for the past 20 years. She says selling these products is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. Akosua is a member of the group called First King Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other by providing social collateral and assisting one another to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like maize and gari.

loans.name: Gullzaman

texts.en:
This is Gullzaman, son of G., and he is 43 years old. He is married and the father of nine children, and he is uneducated. He lives in Nangarhar province, Jalalabad city. He is a good farmer and has his own land in his village. He grows different kinds of vegetables on his land.

Gullzaman has four sons and five daughters. His eldest son is a painter and is working in the Kabul. His second son is a student of fifth class in the public school and helps his father in his spare time. They live in a large single house in the village.

Gullzaman wishes to buy some seeds and other things for his land, and a motorcar. For that, he needs 50000AF / US$1075 as an individual loan. He contacted the lender AFSG and requested that they give him this much for 18 months. He has his own capital of 50000AF that he wants to include with this loan to buy a motorcar, so he can easily transport his vegetables for sale at the bazaar. He says "thanks" to Kiva - Loans That Change Lives.

loans.use: To buy some seeds and other things for his land, and a motorcar

loans.name: Minh

texts.vi: Chị Minh tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài trồng trọt và chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nghề đánh bắt và buôn bán cá. Công việc chăn nuôi và buôn bán cá của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua bộ lưới mới phục vụ cho việc đánh bắt cá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Minh joined TYM fund in 2001. Her first loan was used to invest in raising pigs. Presently, in addition to farming and raising pigs, her family also has a fishing business. Her farming and fishing business are expanding and bring in average income of 180 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 725 USD to buy new fishing nets for their fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nets for fishing business

loans.name: Cristina P.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Cristina K. from Mbarali. She married with five children between the ages of 2 and 15.Cristina has been running a maize business since 2000. She buys maize from farmers and brings them back to her town where she can sell them for a higher price. She works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to purchase more maize in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Cristina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize in bulk

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en  1970, Mlle A. Akouvi est mère d’un (01) enfant. Infirmière de formation, elle a une grande passion pour la santé et le bien être humain. Elle est toujours concentrée sur son travail et l’exerce avec beaucoup de sérieux, car pour elle « la santé n’a pas de prix ». Afin de mieux s’équiper en matériels de travail et s’approvisionner en produits pharmaceutiques, elle sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés de ses activités lui permettront de veiller à l’éducation de son enfant et de mieux organiser sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Miss Akouvi A., born in 1970, is the mother of one child. She is a registered nurse with a great passion for health and human welfare. She is always concentrated on her work and does it earnestly, since she realizes that "health is a pearl beyond price." So as to better equip herself with what she needs for her work and to stock up on medicines, she is requesting a loan. The income from her work will allow her to assure her child of a good education and better organize her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Koem Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Pov P. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She faces some problems today because she does not have the rice seeds she needs to plant a new crop. In order to deal with this problem and make her field more productive, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides. Mrs. Koen Pov P. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her third child earns a living making pots.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 45-year-old married man with two children, living in Fourn Al Chebak in Beirut. Since his teenage years he has been working as a house painter, and nowadays he is responsible for the renovation of several houses. Today, Georges is requesting $1,200 to buy paint at a very good price, in order to re-sell it and increase his profits.

loans.use: Buy paint to re-sell

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass U. buys and sells cashew nuts in bags. He is 32 years old and married with one child.

He hopes for the loan amount of N1400000 to purchase more bags of cashew nuts to sell.

U. lives in Jattu in the Edo state of Nigeria.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cashew nut to sell

loans.name: Jamolbek

texts.en:
S. Jamolbek is 30 years old and is married with two children. He is a farmer and grows wheat, corn, and tomatoes, something he has done for 5 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Jamolbek, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. Jamolbek also raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. 

Now Jamolbek wants to borrow money to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops. This is Jamolbek's first loan from IMON International and he promises to repay the loan without any violations as he has done with previous loans.

About Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El sr. Juan se dedica al lavado de arena y piedra, en el río Jachaconi, él saca la arena y la piedra del río y luego los vende a los camioneros para que ellos los vendan después en la ciudad para las construcciones. Vive con su esposa en la comunidad de Chinchaya, donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a esta actividad, sus hijos ya son independientes, y cuando tiene muchos pedidos le ayudan en el trabajo. Es un buen cliente, ,muy responsable, tuvo una desgracia, su casita se vio afectada por las riadas de las lluvias, todas sus pertenencias quedaron enterradas, se están recuperando poco a poco, siempre con optimismo y dispuestos a trabajar fuerte y duro, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas herramientas.
texts.en:
For a living Mr. Juan washes sand and stone. In the Jachaconi river, he pulls sand and stone from the river and then sells it to truck drivers so they can then sell it in the city for construction. He lives with his wife in the Chinchaya community, where the majority of residents are engaged in this activity. His children are already independent, and he has many requests that help him with his work. He is a good customer, very responsible, who had a stroke of bad luck when his little house was hit by flood rains and all of their belongings were buried. They are recovering slowly, always optimistic and willing to work long and hard, they will invest the loan to purchase new tools.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of tools.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Mashavu has been a clothes (khanga) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. "Khanga" is a brightly patterned African print fabric. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $25. She works at her business for eight hours every day.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, one of Kiva's field partners, so that she can buy more khanga for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to broaden her business and save money for future use.  

Mashavu is thirty-five years old and married with three children, ages fourteen, twelve, and seven. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Zainab, who has her own small business selling clothes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more khanga for resale.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji G. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions and medicines. She is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Cinthia Maria

texts.es: La Señora Cinthia María C. tiene la edad de 44 años. Cinthia esta casada con Juan. Tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulperia. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con muy pocos prodcutos ya que no ofrecia una gran variedad, pero con el muy poco dinero que recogia de sus ganancias logro aumentar su pulperia, y con la yuda de los financiamientos que fueron de gran ayuda para iniciar este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos basicos,jabones, detergentes y golosinas. El sueño de Cinthia es diversificar en sus productos y convertir su pequeña pulperia en una distribuidoa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cinthia María C. is 44 years old and married to Juan. They have 1 dependent child. She owns a grocery store and has been in business for more than 4 years. When she started, she had few products and did not offer great variety, but with the little money she saved from her earnings was able to open her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy basic grains, soaps, detergents and candy. Cinthia dreams of diversifying her products and converting her small grocery store into a wholesale outlet.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells kerosene. She has been in the business for 5 years. She lives in Lagos State. Yemi is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to buy more kerosene to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a member of Tuwe macho borrower group. She is a 40-year-old woman, married and the mother of two children. Her children are aged 15 and 7.

Khadija started her own clothing business selling clothes two years ago. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Khadija's first loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to use that loan to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she will receive from the use of this loan, Khadija hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La joven Noemí M. de 28 años de edad, se caso a los veinte años con su esposo de profesión ebanista, tiene un hijo de dos años,  desde hace un año se ha dedicado al negocio de cuajadas, y zapatos y ropa por encargo, y hasta ahora le ha ido bien ya que es un producto consumible por todos los Nicaragüenses, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de zapatos y en cantidad de cuajadas para seguir ofertando en diferentes sectores y captar clientela para obtener mejores utilidades de ganancias, lo cual utilizara con los ahorros la remodelación de su casa. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar zapatos y cuajadas

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 24 años, es un hombre muy laborioso, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo en la casa de sus padres. De lunes a viernes se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en auto, desde su pueblo hasta la ciudad, sus clientes generalmente son profesores que se movilizan hacia las escuelas rurales, realizando al día de 2 a 3 viajes. Pero como acaba de iniciar sus actividades agrícolas, los fines de semana, se dedica a cultivar sus chacras de papas y arvejas, las cuales una vez cosechadas las transporta en su auto hacia el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad. Con las ganancias se anticipa en la compra de abonos para asegurar su próxima siembra, pues piensa convertirse en un distribuidor de papas muy conocido en su zona.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarles problemas a sus compañeros de banco comunal, donde se ha ganado el aprecio de todos. El dinero que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de 2 llantas para su carro, asimismo adquirirá 4 sacos de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Moisés is 24 year old and a very industrious man. He lives with his partner, who is the mother of his child, in the home of his parents. From Monday through Friday, he transports passengers by automobile from the village into the city. His customers are mostly teachers who need to travel among the rural schools, usually making 2 to 3 trips each day.

Moisés just started farming on the weekends. He cultivates his land with potatoes and peas and transports his harvest in his car to the wholesale market in the city. With the anticipated earnings, he plans to buy fertilizers for his next crop because he thinks he is becoming a well-known distributor of potatoes in the area.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Moisés is willing to make all of his payments because he does not want to cause problems for the other members of his Communal Bank, of whom he has earned their appreciation. The money he requested will be used to purchase 2 tires for his car as well as 4 sacks of chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his car & fertilizers for his potato field

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica N., 47 years old, is from Surallah, South Cotabato where she manages a two-hectare rice field that yields three crops each year.  The harvest, her main source of income, is very helpful in sustaining her family. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy farm necessities. To be able to finance her business with a lower interest rate from CEVI  allows Veronica to run a more profitable enterprise.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha, es natural D. la ciudad D. Cusco, ella pertenece al banco comunal,” Fuerza Compartida”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito D. huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años D. edad, ella tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo D. auxiliar en un jardín D. niños, nuestra socia ama a los niños, tiene la paciencia y la dulzura que los merecen. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal, ella cubrirá mes a mes los pagos D. las cuotas con su sueldo, por el momento ella desea invertir este dinerito en un trabajito adicional al del jardín D. niños.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Bertha is a native of Cusco and a member of the Community Bank "Fuerza Compartida", which is located in the city of Cusco, Huanchaco district.

Our partner is 43 years old, is married and has 3 children. She alternates her household activities with her job as an assistant in a kindergarten. She loves children, is patient and sweet.

She is asking for a personal loan and will make monthly payments with her salary. She wants to invest the loan money in an additional activity than her kindergarten job.

She agrees to make the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Maria Jesus' Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Almendro esta formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y que tienen una buena amistad entre ellas. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Maria Elba F., es la lider del grupo y es una persona muy responsable, se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de bloques de concreto, esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo. Maria desea adquirir mejores herramientas para poder producir mas bloques de cemento.
La señora Maria Jesus H. A. es madre de 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida, golosinas y refrescos en su glorieta del barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Su proposito es sacar adelante a su familia y hacer crecer su negocio.
