La señora Maria Isabel F. es madre de tres hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, Maria se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, agua galletas, confites y frutas de temporada, ella quiere un dia poder comprar su propio puesto de venta en el mercado pricipal de la ciudad de Nacaome.
todas ellas son mujeres luchadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todas ellas necesitan el credito para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Almendro is composed of three hard-working women, who are close friends. Bellow is a list of their various activities: Mrs. Maria Elba F. is the group leader and is a very responsible person. She makes her living from the production and sale of concrete blocks – an activity which she performs with the help of her husband and children. Maria would like to get better tools in order to make more concrete blocks. Mrs. Maria Jesus H. A. has two children and makes her living from the sale of food, candy, and soda in the main square of her neighborhood, San Jose, which is in Nacaome City. She is motivated by the desire to help her family prosper and develop her business. Mrs. Maria Isabel F. has three grown-up children. Maria makes her living from the sale of soda, juice, water, cookies, candy, and seasonal fruit. One day, she would like to be able to buy her own stall in the main market in Nacaome City. All three of these women are true fighters with strong desires to succeed. All of them need this loan to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda, bottled water, beans, rice, sugar, corn, juice, fruit, cement

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely C. is from Iligan City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Ely owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Las Marianitas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las Marianitas” está formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres dinámicas y perseverantes, la mayoría vive en el distrito de Campo verde región de Ucayali, la presidenta, Lina del pilar C. G., es madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es docente pedagógico. Las socias que forman este Banco Comunal trabajan en diferentes labores como; venta de pescado, abarrotes, carnes, frutas, golosinas, verduras, bebidas, etc. Este Banco forma parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  Credi-mujer desde hace cuatro meses, donde siempre han demostrado ser unas socias puntuales. En la actualidad este banco necesita un crédito de 4800 soles que será utilizado en los diferentes negocios en las que ellas se desempeñan. Este grupo está agradecido por la confianza que depositaron en ellas porque gracias a los préstamos ellas pueden invertir en sus negocios y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Marianitas” (the MaryAnns) is formed by a group of 10 dynamic and persevering women, the majority of whom live in the Campo Verde (Green Field) District of the Ucayali region. The President, Lina del Pilar C. G., is a mother of three children. She sells food and relies on the support of her husband who is a school teacher/docent. The members are part of the Communal Bank working in different fields; selling fish, groceries, meat, fruit, tidbits, vegetables, drinks, etc. This Bank is part of the Manuela Ramos Movement--for Women's Loans, formed four months ago, and the associates have been punctual in their payments. Presently, this Group needs a loan of 4800 soles that will be used in the different businesses in which the various members are employed. This group appreciates the confidence placed in them because thanks to these loans, they can invest in their businesses and move forward in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: use the loan for different businesses: selling fish, groceries, meat, fruit, tidbits, vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de seis hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y paralelamente vende repuestos de motos.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace nueve años donde se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en los pagos. El primer crédito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en telas e hilos para confeccionar prendas.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà telas, hilos y elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlos. 
La meta de María es llegar a tener un taller bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Angelica is a dynamic and contributing woman who lives in the Pucallpa Region of Ucayali. She is 58 years old, a mother of six children, and counts on the support of her husband. She makes clothing, and concurrently also sells spare parts for motorcycles. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Madres Corajes” for the past nine years, and is known for being punctual in her payments. The first loan that she received of 300 PEN allowed her to invest in fabrics and threads to make her garments. Currently she needs a loan of 300 PEN which she will use to purchase fabrics, threads, and elastic to make blouses that she will later sell. Maria’s goals are have a well established sewing shop, and to continue improving her economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase fabrics, threads, and elastic to make blouses.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 27 años, es una joven muy responsable y tranquila, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Todos los días, llegadas las 8 de la mañana, abre las puertas de sus cabinas de Internet para atender a sus clientes, su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que sus computadoras son de última generación  y sus muebles muy cómodos. Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que siempre para muy lleno.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que tiene el Internet a la mano para realizar sus trabajos de la universidad, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad, considera que lo más difícil es tener que estar pendiente de que los malos clientes no se lleven ningún accesorio de la computadora. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de sus cabinas de Internet para colocar más computadoras.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rocío con MFP, ella siempre ahorra dinero para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos accesorios para sus computadoras, para reemplazar los que por el paso del tiempo se han malogrado.
texts.en:
Rocío, 27 years old, is a very responsible and quite young woman. She lives with her parents and her greatest desire is to get ahead in her life. Every day at eight o'clock in the morning she opens the doors of her internet cafe and waits for her customers. Her place is very popular, since she offers computers of the last generation and the furniture is very confortable. She is doing very well with her business, since her internet cafe is always crowded. The advantage in this job is that she can use the net any time for her college homeworks. She has been in this business for the past three years and in her opinion the most difficult aspect of the job is to make sure that some customer does not steal anything. For the future she wishes to have more internet cabins in order to install more computers. This is Rocio's second loan with MFP and she is always saving so that she is able to pay back on schedule. She is a lovely person and she works hard to support her commune bank. With the 1000 PEN she requested she will buy new accessories for her computers, in order to replace the old ones, that are used up.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer accessories

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
la sra. Deysi M. V. tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de sandalias y utensilios de plastico para el hogar, como ser picheles, quita tela arañas, coladores,limpiadores de servicios etc.
tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, en este momento necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia ya que esta vendiendo bastante en estos ultimos dias.
se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo. 
vende sus productos de manera ambulante en diferentes empresas privadas y estatales de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Deysi necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi M. V. is 42 years old, and she sells sandals and plastic utensils for the home, like pitchers, items to remove spider webs, strainers, cleaners for the bathroom etc.

Deysi has some years of experience in this business and she needs the loan to buy more merchandize since she is selling a lot these days.

She is very happy because her business is growing.

Deysi sells her products as a roving salesperson to different private and state businesses of the city of San Lorenzo.

Deysi needs the loan to get ahead in life with her family and business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and plastic utensils.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Protector 1 Group

texts.en:
Micheline is the coordinator of her group Jehova es Mi Protector (God is my protector), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, a city known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their child.

Micheline is excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling children's clothing and bedsheets by purchasing more merchandise for her ambulatory business. She will use the profits to pay her tuition, she is studying engineering at university. Her long term goal is to see both herself and her child become engineers. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing, sheets etc.

loans.name: Norman De Jesús

texts.es:
Norman S. es casado y con dos hijos a los que les debe de proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en el municipio de Nagarote.
Es importante señalar que el señor Norman es muy trabajador y a diario se esfuerza en su centro de labores porque anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra cantera para la construcción de una tapia en su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle a su esposa e hijos las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Norman S. is married and has two children for whom he must provide everything they need to grow and develop; he lives in Nagarote. It's important to point out that Norman is very hard-working and does his best every day at his place of employment because he wants to improve his home's conditions. He will use the requested funds to buy building materials, like paving stones, to build a stone wall for his home thus providing his wife and children with the necessary conditions for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane G., 31 years old, is a rice farmer. She lives in Norala Cotabato together with her two children. She started farming back in 1999. The farm that she has tilled for ten years is the one helping her cover daily expenses in their home. She desires a bountiful harvest so that she could be able to accommodate the needs of her family.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. If she gets a loan, she will be able to grow her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie A. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling personal use products such as body sprays, talc powder, lotions and makeup in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the city of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. Melanie has been in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es: Santos de Jesús E. de 54 años de edad, reside en  Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a cinco hijos de los cuales los tres mayores le ayudan con el negocio, y junto a dos nietos. Santos posee una venta de piñatas, dulces, platos y cucharas y todos los accesorios necesarios para poder hacer una fiesta de cumpleaños y otros eventos especiales. Así mismo comercializa flotadores, lentes para sol, pegamentos, y productos plásticos; el negocio esta ubicado en el centro de Santa Tecla, en uno de los lugares que más comercio posee ya que todos los negocios en este lugar venden por mayoreo. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar papel, alambre  pegamentos para la elaboración de piñatas que posteriormente comercializa en su negocio, así mismo aumentar todos sus productos para poder atender mayor cantidad de clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Santos de Jesús E., 54, lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with 5 children, 3 of whom are grown and help her with her business, and 2 grandchildren. Santos has a business selling piñatas, candy, plates, spoons and all of the accessories needed to be able to have a birthday party or other type of special event. She also sells pool floats, sunglasses, adhesives and plastic products. This business is located in the center of Santa Tecla, in one of the most commercial areas, as all of the businesses in this area are wholesale businesses. Santos requests a loan to buy paper, wire, and adhesives for making piñatas that she will later sell in her business. In addition, she wants to increase her products to provide a greater quantity of products for her customers. She does all of this with the desire of improving the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make piñatas.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
Jaria Ramadhan, age 51, is married with 7 children.  She has been having a kiosk business (selling juice, water, sodas) for one year.  She works from 8am to 8pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $306.

This will be Jaria’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the capital and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase stock of her business. 

Jaria will share this loan with her loan group Waukee, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Jaria is in the middle with an orange dress, front row.

loans.use: To increase stock of her business

loans.name: Welfreda

texts.en:
Mrs. Welfreda C. is from Bogo, Capalaran Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old and married with four children. Of her four children, only one went to school. She is a PDP-LP member and her husband is a laborer. Mrs. Welfreda is a vendor at IBJT, Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She has been operating her business for a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.
   
She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. Now she has a new loan of 5000 PHP taken from PMPC and this loan is intended for additional capital for her business. This was her second cycle of availing of loans from PMPC. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital of her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 62 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hijo en el distrito agrícola D. Cayaltí, una zona ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

La necesidad D. hacerse cargo D. su familia hizo que empezara a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales menores. Agustina suele criar sus animales en unos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los venD. a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan  la zona en donD. vive. Con las ganancias D. este negocio pudo ahorrar dinero para adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar pasajeros y carga) la cual utiliza actualmente en brindar servicio D. transporte en la zona donD. vive.

El contínuo uso otorgado al vehículo y el estado accidentado D. las carreteras D. la zona ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que necesitan D. reparación urgente para garantizar el correcto funcionamiento D. su unidad móvil, por ello Agustina se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Agustina es una mujer luchadora,ella ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. las dificultades que se le han presentado. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir en el futuro otra mototaxi.
texts.en:
Agustina is 62, widowed, and lives with her child in the agricultural district of Catalti, a zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Out of the need to care for her family she started raising and selling small animals. Agustina usually raises her animals in pens located in the back part of her home, and when they have reached a good point of development she sells them to the dealers who always frequent the area where she lives. With the earnings from this business she was able to save money for a mototaxi (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle that has an attached cabin for transporting passengers and cargo) which she currently uses to offer a transportation service in her area. The continual use of the vehicle and the rough state of the roads in her area have maD. the vehicle start to experience various issues that require urgent repair to ensure proper functioning. Because of this, Agustina has found it necessary to apply, for the first time, to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles. Agustina is a fighter. She has managed to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen. Her greatest wish is to be able to buy another mototaxi in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of mototaxi

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
Cinderella O. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Cinderella is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cinderella owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cinderella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cinderella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cinderella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cinderella is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Cinderella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SÉRIEUX est créé le 17 juillet 2006. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de VELINGARA FOULBE MAREWE. 

Les membres ont formé leur groupe par affinité et s'activent toutes dans le domaine commerciale (vente de fruits, de légumes, d'huile de palme et de pâte d'arachide.

Madame Aïssatou BOLO D., à l'extrême droite de la photo, vêtue de bleu avec des rayures verticales en blanc est la présidente du Groupe de Solidarité. 

Elle est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide, d'huile de palme et de fruits. Elle a une bonne expérience dans le domaine d'activité pour l'avoir mené depuis plus de 4 ans. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The group "Solidarité SÉRIEUX" was created on JuL. 17, 2006. It is composed of 11 women from the same neighborhood. The group is a member of the "Banc Villageois de VELINGARA FOULBE MAREWE". The members formed their own group out of affinity, and do business in a variety of domains (selling fruits, vegetables, palm oil, and peanut butter). Mrs. Aïssatou BOLO D. (far right in the picture, wearing a blue dress with white vertical stripes) is the president of the group "Solidarité SÉRIEUX". She's 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has a small business selling peanut butter, palm oil, and fruits. She has a good experience in this field, since she's been running this business for four years. Her goal is to help her husband with the various expenses of the famiL., as well as to bolster her savings.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut butter, and fruits

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: Ludivina F. is from the village of Bago. She is 57 years old and is marriedwith three adult children. Ludivina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ludivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to finish her kitchen. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finish her kitchen

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón C. es padre de familia y tienes dos hijos de mediana edad y quiere darles la  seguridad en la casa. Pero le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. 
Solicita un préstamo para poderle pagar a la persona que se encargara de realizar las protecciones.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleado de una escuela.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. is a father with two adolescent children. He wants to give them a safe environment at home, but their house lacks protection on the windows and doors. He is requesting a loan in order to pay someone to install security measures. He plans to pay off the loan with the income he receives from his work as an employee in a school.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding security to the doors and windows of his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent, purchase cereal stock, pay for a business license and purchase fruits for soft drink sales.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en: Cheang K., 36, is married and lives with her husband in the TaK. province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1.50 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Cheang K. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1200 to make a new investment. Since farming doesn't provide enough money to raise her family, she would like to use the loan from CREDIT to run a hairdressing shop. She believes that this new business will allow her family to earnmore money.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.ru:
Nizami A. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, doch 18 let kotoraya v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Nizami yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region.

Nizami uje eto vtoroy ssud. Pervuyu ssudu brala yeqo jena Sevindj Aliyeva. Oni ochen blagodarni za ssudu. Nizami uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy video apparat tak kak yeqo apparat isportilsya i on ne mojet rabotat.
texts.en:
Nizami A. is 40 years old. He is married and has two children: an 18-year-old daughter who this year will enter university and a 15-year-old son who is a student in school. Nizami is an internally-displace person (IDP); he moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Nizami is already on his second loan. The first loan was taken by his wife Sevindj Aliyeva. They are very grateful for the loans. Nizami has been engaged in this business for 7 years. Now he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a new video camera because his camera is broken and therefore he cannot work.

loans.use: To purchase a new video camera

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is from the village of Tipan,Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ . She is 50 years old, married, and has two adult children. Fe is involved in fish pond fattening, which she has been doing for about 30 years. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.  In 2004, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe's twelfth loan from PMPC was for 14,900 PHP.  She is now requesting a new loan for 14,900 PHP for additional inventory for her business and to financially support her immediate family members. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire additional inventory for her fish pond fattening

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en: Bulgantamir S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His sons, ages 12 and 8, are secondary school students. Bulgantamir and his wife operate a cafe and a taxi service in their town. Bulgantamir started driving a taxi in 2002 and built a stable and successful business that has allowed him to begin operating a cafe in a rented space at the local market. His wife is responsible for managing the cafe while Bulgantamir drives a taxi. They have been successful in both ventures and have a strong customer base throughout their community. Bulgantamir wants to provide fast and reliable service for his customers. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for the cafe and parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for a cafe

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta de 44 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar,labora para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 20 años como operadora de microcomputadora, ademas vende productos AVON y ZERMAT para obtener ingresos adicionales. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de construir un sumidero para los servicios higienicos de su casa, pues desea hacer el inodoro, y como su patio es pequeño le resultaria mejor esta construccion.  

Expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los creditos obtenidos ha ido poco a poco ir construyendo su casita.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 44 years old and single.  She has two school age children.

For twenty years she has worked as a microcomputer operator for the Asuncion hospital.  She also sells Avon and Zermat products to get additional income.

She is requesting her sixth loan to build a drain for hygienic services for her house.  She wants to put in a lavatory.  As her patio is small, it will be better with this construction.

She is grateful to AFODENIC because the loans that she has received have been to, little by little, build her house.

loans.use: Put in a drain for hygienic services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for his son’s wedding

loans.name: Marisol Elizabet

texts.es:
Marisol  ha trabajado como costurera muchos años para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Su primera costura fue cuando empezó a trabajar haciendo camisas y pantalones en un taller de costura pero como tenía que trabajar todo el día. Decidió con sus ahorros comprar una máquina de coser y promocionar sus costuras a sus vecinos y amigos.   
Viviendo con sus dos hijos ha convertido una parte de la casa en su taller de costura y confección. Empieza a las 10h00am hacer los pedidos de ropa que tiene pendiente del día siguiente. Ella hace camisas, pantalones, blusas de hombres, mujeres o niños.
Para seguir operando con su máquina de coser ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y comprar cemento, arena, bloques para mejorar su casa (como aparece en la foto). En el futuro quiere tener su taller bien espacioso para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marisol has worked as a seamstress for many years to support her children and her mother who is now single.  She started by making shirts and pants in a workshop but she had to work all day.  She decided to use her savings to buy a sewing machine and promote her own work among her neighbors and friends.

Living with her two children she has converted part of her house into a dressmaking and sewing shop.  She starts working on orders at 10 am that are due the next day.  She makes  pants, blouses and shirts for men, women and children.

So that she can continuing working with her sewing machine, Marisol wants to use the loan to buy fabric, cement, and blocks to improve her house (as  shown in the photo).  In the future she would like to have a spacious area to better serve her customers.

loans.use: Fabric, cement, blocks

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo menor, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02  años,  su  préstamo  inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el cual compró artículos de perfumería y cosméticos.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, cremas, también hará pavos rellenos por navidad para ello comprara pavos, pollos, frutas, tocinos, jamón, etc., es ayudada por su hermana y su esposo trabaja como taxista.

Su visión a futuro es abrir una tienda, comprar maquinarias y vender productos pre cocidos.
	
Lo que le gusta son las reglas del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” community bank in the district, province, and department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, single, and has a young son, who is in secondary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years.  Her initial loan was for S/. 300.00 new soles, which she used to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

She is asking for a new loan to invest in beauty products, such as lipstick, perfume, powders, creams, and to make stuffed turkeys for Christmas (she needs to buy turkeys, chickens, fruit, bacon, ham, etc.).  Her sister and her husband, who drives a taxi, will help her.

In the future, she hopes to buy a shop, buy equipment, and sell pre-cooked products.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, such as lipstick, perfumes, powders and also other Christmas products

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine sells vegetables. She is 22 years old, and married with two children who are between one and five years old. One of her children attends school. Her husband works as a bartender. Valentine has been in this business of selling vegetables for eight years. With this loan, she will add more vegetables such as tomatoes and carrots to sell. Valentine hopes to build a house from the profits and to continue paying school fees for her children in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bayarnemeh

texts.en: Bayarnemeh, 38, is divorced and lives with her three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house that they own on the outskirts of the city and all her children attend the local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. She began a shoe sales business in 2006. She sells new and used shoes at a rented stall at the outdoor market. She has been operating her shoe stall continuously and her business has become more stable. Since she has gained enough experience from her business, she is planning to have her own stall or kiosk where she can operate her business. She is an honest and modest person who says, " I would like to expand my business and increase my profit in order to save money for my children's further study." She is requesting a loan of 600,000 tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoes to sell at her stall in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 35 years old and has three children who are between the ages of 1 and 11 years old. She owns a shop from which she sells several items such as rice and sugar, and her husband works with her. Angelique is requesting a loan in order to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice etc. for her store

loans.name: He's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. He, who was born in 1954, is the village bank president. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow both corn and peanuts for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nhoel, was born in 1952, works as a construction worker and is able to earn a small salary to help support his family.  Currently their house has become broken, and they want to fix it up. So in order to support this purpose, Mrs. He would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings and fix her house up. The rest of the loan she will use to build a porch.

This couple has a child who is seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To add to her savings and fix her house up.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, ella vive allí hace más de 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que entrega todos los días a los obreros de una construcción, ya que su esposo es Constructor Contratista. Así que ella esta haciendo compras cada dos o tres días y la mayoría de los trabajadores el cancelan de forma quincenal, por lo que ella necesita de capital de trabajo para realizar sus compras, como arroz y además de que está por comprar envases personales para cada almuerzo, ya que actualmente entrega en platos desechables para cada almuerzo con el dinero del crédito comprara todo esto.  Ella tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ayuda a mantener con su negocio, así están terminando de pagar su lote que compro a crédito. La Sra. Margarita se Caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y carismática, ella ya ha trabajado con grupos y ahora esta en crédito individual.
texts.en: Margarita lives in the zone of the First Villa of Mayo. She has lived there more than five years. She sells meals that she delivers every day to some construction workers, since her husband is a contractor. Since she makes purchases every two or three days, and the majority of the workers are paying their tabs every fifteen days, she needs working capital to make her purchases, such as rice and other items like individual beverages to go with each lunch. Now she is using disposable plates for the lunches, and she will use her loan money to purchase all these types of things. She has four children who help her run her business; they are just finishing paying for the things she bought on credit. Margarita characterizes herself as a responsible and charismatic person. She has worked with groups before, and this is her first individual loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other products wholesale

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A., 40, is married with one child who is in school. She is a very  hard working entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura A. is the leader of this group. She is 31 years old and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband, she is raising a son and two daughters.  The son and the elder daughter are at school.  The second daughter does not yet attend school as she is preschool age (younger than seven). 

The family resides in Tup, a small village in the Isykul region. Five years ago, Ainura’s brother presented her with a calf, and since that moment she has been breeding farm animals.  She sells 11 liters of milk every day, which earns her 2000 soms per month.  With money received from this loan, Ainura wants to purchase three sheep in order to fatten them and resell them at a higher price.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jazmín lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es Gisell Campo Obando de 24 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 2 años. Ella inicio con la venta de ropa y zapatos y luego invirtió en el otro negocio.
Los otros integrantes son Jaqueline D. de 26 años se dedica al comercio  de cosméticos desde hace 4 años, Elia E. de 50 años vende verduras, gaseosa y helados y Francisco José Gutiérrez vende cosméticos hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The “Jazmín” (Jasmine) group is composed of four hard working, dedicated people.  One of them is Gisell Campo Obando, 24.  She’s been selling cosmetics for the last two years.  She started selling clothes and shoes and then invested in the other business.

The other members are: Jaqueline D., 26, who has sold cosmetics for the last four years, Elia E., 50, who sells vegetables, soft drinks and ice cream and Francisco José Gutiérrez who has sold cosmetics for the last two years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 46 years old, married and has seven children: three daughters and four sons. Only two of them are able to get education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son works in a private organization while the others stay at home. 

Nusrat is very supportive and does sewing and embroidery for her neighborhood clients to financially help her husband. She is very skillful in her work and can produce quality work which helps attract many customers to her.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business of selling groceries. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries such as cooking oil, soap, spices, etc. in bulk which will help him fulfill the demand of his customers and make extra profits. 

He started this business 15 years ago and Nusrat is very hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her family and help in improving its living standard. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 1 child, age 4 years old. In 2008, Mohamed established his top-up and mobile phones business. He began his business because he wants to make himself independent and self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid a previous loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more top-up (recharge cards) for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to own a big mobile phone shop and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards and E-vouchers for mobile phones

loans.name: Amancay Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANCAY” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Eva. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de llaucha, venta de celulares, trenzado de mantas, venta de jugos y frescos, venta de verduras.
 
La señora Eva,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llauchas, que viene trabajando hace ocho años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las Llauchas (compra de harina, manteca,etc.), este material lo compra de la Ceja y por mayor, posterior a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amancay” (Lily) will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as a part of Centro Panamericana (Pan-american Center).  The communal bank is made up of six members and is run by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Eva.  The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them we have: llaucha (a Bolivian hotpocket) sales, cell phone sales, blanket plaiting, juice and soda sales and vegetable sales.
 
Sra. Eva notes that this is the first time the communal bank has joined with Pro Mujer and that they were invited to join by an advocate.  Currently, Sra. Eva has a business selling "llauchas" (a Bolivian hot pocket), which she has been doing for the last eight years.

The loan that Sra. Eva is receiving is for the purchase of raw materials to make her llauchas (flour, lard etc.).  She purchases these products wholesale in La Ceja.  After making the llauchas, she distributes them as ordered.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sra. Eva responds that she likes the savings and health plans.

loans.use: to purchase flour, lard etc.

loans.name: Laure Rachel Estelle

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 39 ans célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 21 ans. Quand elle finit sa formation en Coupe et Couture, sa mère lui fait cadeau d’une machine à coudre et elle ouvre un atelier de couture en 1996. Elle a une forte clientèle et elle a en moyenne 55000 a 60000 Frs par jour des recettes. 

Avec le troisième prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle va acheter des tissus et pagnes et faire des camisoles, des chemises, des ensembles dames, des robes pour enfant qu’elle va vendre à ses clients et en dehors de cela il y a aussi les commandes de clientes qu’elle reçoit chaque jour. 

Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre se situent dans l’accumulation des commandes et les clients qui ne respectent pas leur rendez vous ainsi que par manque d’électricité stable qui ne lui permet pas de travailler jusqu’au soir. 

A l’avenir elle pense ouvrir une école de couture pour la réinsertion des jeunes filles mères et les aider à la longue à se prendre en charge Elle pense aussi continuer ses cours de designer pour être modéliste et faire des défiles de mode dans le futur.
texts.en:
Laure is a 39-year-old seamstress. She is single and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 7 and 21. When she finished her training in dressmaking, her mother gave her a sewing machine as a present. She opened a sewing shop in 1996. She has a strong customer base and brings in an average of 55,000 to 60,000 Frs each day.

With the third loan she is seeking, she plans to buy fabric and "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and make camisoles, shirts, ladies' outfits, and children's dresses to sell to her clients. She also takes orders from her clients every day.

The difficulties she encounters include a backlog of orders, clients who miss appointments, and a lack of steady electrical supply which would allow her to work until the evening.

In the future she would like to open a sewing school for young, single mothers and help them learn to support themselves in the long term. She also plans to continue her design courses in order to become a designer and have runway shows in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and "pagnes" to make camisoles and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an oven.

loans.name: Enkhzul

texts.en:
Enkhzul is a 21-year-old married lady who lives with her husband and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works for a company that is located out of town; therefore, she mostly lives with her sister during summer.  

Enkhzul operates a cellphone and cellphone-parts business out of a rented stall in the local trade center. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more mobile phones and other related products, with the goal of increasing the variety of products she offers. She usually buys her products from the main suppliers and other local markets.

Enkhzul wishes to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
Mery Luz nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 49 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive junto con sus dos hijos en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cerveza en el mercado de Rosaspata de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Mery Luz requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza y gaseosas. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mery Luz was born in the city of Quillabamba in the department of Cusco (Peru) and is 49 years old. She currently lives with her 2 children in the same city where she was born and where she has her business. She works selling sodas and beer in the Rosapata market of the city of Cusco. Mery Luz is taking the opportunity to request a loan to buy merchandise such as been and sodas.
The community bank "Virgen de Capi" meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a an area for tourists and business, for its traditional fiesta of Inti Raymi, and for being the home of Machupicchu, one of the 7 Wonders of the World.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such a beer and sodas.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Amah est une femme âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 01 enfant  de 19ans qui est scolarisé. 
Amah travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe très utilisé chez nous au Togo depuis 2003. Elle vend à la maison.
Amah a requis son  quatrième cycle de prêt crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut agrandir son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amah voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut subvenir aux besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amah, age 55, is married to a retiree. She has one 19-year-old child who attended school. Since 2003, she's been working as a firewood reseller, a product very much used in Togo. She sells from her home. 

Amah is seeking her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more supplies. In the forthcoming years, she would like expand her business. She says that with her profits, she can provide for her family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal sacks

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is 37 years old and married with four children living in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda. Fred operates a shop and he has been in the business for five months. Fred started with 300,000 shillings but now has stock worth over 1,000,000 shillings. He has a challenge of the current inflation, which has led to high costs of operation and his dream is to own a wholesale shop. The purpose of the loan is to buy more shop items like sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and curry powder to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and curry powder to sell.

loans.name: Damaris Kavee

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years old, married and has six children aged between 2 and 15. She hopes to give a good education to her children to the university level.
Damaris sells clothes at a shopping center in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Damaris has been selling dresses, trousers, etc. for the last five years to local people. She says that this business is profitable but the major challenge she has is that in some seasons she registers low sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to restock her clothes business to grow it into a boutique. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her family. She describes herself as aggressive, committed and responsible.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and blessed with one child. He has been managing a retail shop for the last seven years to make a living. He is also employed as a tan-boy (a trucker's assistant). 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Samuel dreams of operating a taxi business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, wheat flour and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and soap.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 29 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 2 and 5.  The elder child is currently in school. She runs a store where she sells foodstuffs such as maize, bananas, sorghum, sweet potatoes, potatoes and rice.  She would like a loan to expand her inventory of foodstuffs to sell. She has been running this business for 3 years and it has helped her care for her family. She will use the profits from this loan to create savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shalom Of Sewa 2 Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Revonia from Harare. She is single with one child. Revonia runs a manufacturing business producing peanut butter and detergents. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the major challenges she faces are lack of funds, the high costs of transport to carry stock, and price fluctuations. 

Revonia has requested a loan of $150 to purchase groundnuts and raw materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve production levels and increase income for the family. In the future, Revonia plans to open a big peanut butter-making company.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and raw materials

loans.name: Ana Melisa

texts.es: Ana Melisa D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería con la que sostiene el hogar, últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues prepara las tortillas más ricas del lugar, calientitas y con un servicio rápido, además que el material D. su producción es D. mucha calidad y las venD. a un precio accesible; Ana es una mujer entregada a su trabajo y le gusta mantenerse adelante D. la competencia, piensa que para cumplir metas en la vida se necesita D. constancia y dedicación pero su principal secreto es la felicidad y el amor en su labor, quiere hacer creer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor etc.; posee un buen record crediticio y está catalogada D. buena paga. Ana melisa tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Ana Melisa is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and children in their own home.  She has a tortilla making business which supports the household.  Lately she has more customers because her tortillas are the best in the area.  They are warm and served quickly, and the ingredients are top quality, not to mention the low price.  Ana is very dedicated to her work and she likes to stay ahead of the competition.  She believes she can reach her goals by being consistent and dedicated.  But her main secret is happiness and priD. in her work.  She wants to expand her business and has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy wholesale corn, etc.  She has a good credit record and is classified as a good borrower.  Ana Melisa hopes that this will allow her to give her family the best quality of life possible.

loans.use: To buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Chelu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chelu Group in Western Kenya!  Lucy is the facilitator of the Chelu group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lucy takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lucy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lucy was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lucy  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Lucy will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Chelu group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Soc0Rro

texts.es:
Esperanza es originaria del Coyolito municipio de Jinotega, casada, es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 4 están a su cargo, combina su papel de madre de familia con la de agricultora pues se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas labores propia de su comunidad donde las mujeres aportan en sus hogares apoyando en las siembras de hortalizas y granos básicos. Cuando comenzó lo hizo cultivando chiltoma a medias con sus vecinos donde juntos se unieron para sembrar una parcela de esta hortaliza pero hace dos años ella siembra de manera independiente le  ha ido muy bien por que no ha tenido perdidas en sus cultivos. 
Ella realizo el crédito para sembrar chiltomas. Pues en sus planes esta ampliar sus áreas de siembras para que sus hijos sea lo s que en el futuro manejen el negocio pues su meta es que ellos se preparan y se hagan cargo del negocio cuando ella se retire. Por el momento quiere fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo sostenible.
texts.en: Esperanza is originally from Coyolito, municipality of Jinotega. She is married and has six children, four still under her care. She balances her motherly duties with being a farmer, since she makes a living planting vegetables. The women in her community support their families by planting vegetables and basic grains. When she started she was cultivating sweet peppers alongside her neighbors, who came together to plant a parcel of land with the vegetable, but two years ago she started working independently and it has been going very well since she hasn't lost any of her crops. She plans to use the loan to plant sweet peppers. Her plan is to expand her planting area so that her children can manage the business in the future, since her goal is to prepare them to take over the business when she retires. For the moment, she wants to strengthen her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to plant sweet peppers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a poultry farmer who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. This business has been in operation for 9 years. She employs one other person in her farm. Beatrice also owns a boutique in the town of Mombasa. 

Beatrice is married and has five children, all aged above eighteen years and independent. Her main challenge is the rising cost of poultry feed and drugs. She is applying for a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase broiler feed, drugs, and feeders. 

Beatrice looks forward to starting the layers farm in the future. The income obtained from this venture will help meet her basic needs, pay fees for her orphaned grandchild, and provide savings for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase broiler feed, drugs, and feeders.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s animals selling business. By utilizing the loan, he will buy goats and sheep of a young age, grow them up and sell them for a profit to butchers and also on EID season. Her husband is a very dedicated person and loves his animals and takes care of them very well.

Naseem, in her spare time, provides full support to her husband by taking care of the animals. She is also a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profits. She has given birth to 3 sons. Her eldest son is illiterate while the other 2 are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Naseem is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his income and she will be able to continue giving education to her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, she is 56 and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Felix, an overseas contract worker and mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She meets up faithfully with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio se dedica a diferentes actividades para poder sostener a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos. Manuel trabaja cultivando frijoles, arroz y maíz, así mismo cría y comercializa ganado y vende leche. Este es un negocio muy importante para Manuel ya que es el que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar abono para el cultivo de granos básicos y de esta manera contar con frijoles, maíz y arroz de mejor calidad, con lo que pueda dar un mejor producto a sus clientes y de esta forma también obtener otros nuevos gracias a los cuales pueda aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: comprar abono para el cultivo de granos básicos

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El Sr. Gregorio tiene 63 años, el se dedica  a la  venta de  ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Chirapaca, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Gregorio utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca que le están ofreciendo a un bajo costo y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Gregorio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, age 63, sells cattle.  He lives in Chirapaca, where the people devote themselves to farming and livestock.  This is his first cycle within the institution.

Gregorio will use this loan to buy a cow that is being offered at a low cost.  He wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  His reason for requesting this loan is that he does not have money to buy it.  This will help him a great deal, and his income will improve.

The challenge that Gregorio faces in his business is the fodder that he needs to buy on a regular basis.  He will use the profits to improve his livestock.  He dreams of buying other cows and improving his income that way.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Robert, a very hard-working farmer who is 40 years of age and is so full of energy. Robert hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns and favors dairy and crop farming. Robert is a family man and he has nine children and a wife who he really loves, and you can always notice a pleasant feeling among his family members when he arrives at home every day from his farm. 

Robert practices mixed farming--that is, crop and dairy farming--and has been doing this for five years; he also keeps bee and farms tea so that he can make ends meet. Because of his large family, Robert has to work extra hard so that he can feed the nine stomachs that solely depend on him. Because of this, Robert tries to do many businesses so that he can supplement the income from crop farming.

Robert would like to increase his dairy farming and be able to assure his children of a bright future. That is why he is seeking a loan of 57,200 KES to be able to buy a dairy cow, which will help him get more income through selling milk. The financial benefits that Robert will reap out of this investment are immediate because of the ready market for milk that already exists in his area.

Robert is so disciplined with finances and he is sure that through the profits gathered from selling milk, he will be able to save enough and open a large dairy business that will assure his children of a secure future and uninterrupted learning.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en: Stumai is a 19-year-old entrepreneur who is unmarried and lives with her family. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in a nearby secondary school where she teaches students valuable life skills. Currently, Stumai sells groceries to earn an income. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her grocery business. She expects to use the profits from this loan to open a new business selling women’s clothes because there is currently a need for that in her area.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Mrs. Cristina started her grocery store because she has always liked selling since she was a child when her family had a business. When Mrs. Christina retired (she was a teacher), she decided to start her business to earn an additional income to support her family.

She is married and her husband is retired too. They have three children and, when Mrs. Christina and her husband started their business, their children were still studying. Now their children are finished and one of them helps in their business. Cristina has an employee who helps her with the little restaurant that she started a year ago as complement to her groceries business.

Cristina is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to supply her grocery store with merchandise and to buy some furniture that she needs for her restaurant. She wants to pay back in a term of 10-14 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Desde hace 15 años que la Sra. Cristina inicio su negocio de minisuper, siempre le gusto el comercio, pues desde pequeña su familia tenía negocio, pero no fue hasta que se jubiló de maestra, que se decidió a iniciar su negocio, para tener un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su familia. Ella esta casada y su esposo también esta jubilado, tienen tres hijos y cuando iniciaron su negocio sus hijos estaban estudiando, ya terminaron sus estudios y solo uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio. Aparte de la familia, tiene una empleada que le ayuda en su negocio, ya que a los abarrotes los complemento con el servicio de ofrecer comidas y ha tenido una muy buena aceptación.

Cristina esta solicitando un crédito por $ 1,200 USD para surtir de mercancía su negocio de abarrotes y para comprar algo de mobiliario que necesita en las comidas. El plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 10-14 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and furniture

loans.name: Colon

texts.en:
Colon Dumes is a rancher and farmer from a rural town in Ecuador named Salitre. He has lived in the rural area his whole life and he only has a primary education. His two children are already grown up but they work with him on his farm. He is no longer married but is still widely considered as a family man because of the relantionship he maintains with his kids and their children. He will use part of the money from this loan for rice cultivation and the other part to maintain his cattle.

Colon is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount that is missing. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage saving among the group. Promoting saving is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice farming and Cattle Ranching

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Miss Quy and her husband have three children between 7 and 12 years old. The eldest son suffers from a disability, and Miss Quy must also support parents who are 87 and 77 and they are often sick. Miss Quy sells fish at the local market and her husband is a hired laborer, as they don’t have any land for cultivation. Income for her family from her fish sales is not enough so she had to borrow a loan with 36% interest from money lenders. Now Miss Quy wants to borrow $50 through the Kiva program to help her fish business, and she says she will repay her loan monthly.

loans.use: To sell fish at the local market

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence T. sells palm oil, bags of rice and food ingredients. She is from Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria. She is interested borrowing $725 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and other food ingredients

loans.name: Azoble

texts.en: Azoblé E. is a very dynamic single mother. E. is 41 years old. With the first credit she was given, she opened a store of cosmetics products and another various sales business which thrives well. She lives with her 2 children in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She has long experience in micro business. E. takes care to her children life and education expenses from revenues generated from her activities. E. heard about AE&I in June 2005 and benefited her first loan 3 months later. She has performed very well since then.

loans.use: Azoblé Emilienne will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen N. from Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan). Last year I took a loan from ASASAH, a microfinance institution, and bought a rickshaw for my husband. The rickshaw is our major source of income and now it requires maintenance for which we require a loan of US$ 400.

loans.use: repair our rickshaw

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasiani

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Kasiani is the portrait of a super mother and wife. In her daily life she is able to help her husband to increase family income by selling pulse and accessories for hand phones in front of their house.
